title: thor_(marvel)
body:
[[Marvel]] character, based on the mythological god of the same name. The prince of Asgard who was banished to Midgard (Earth) for his arrogance and became a superhero.

He originally had the civilian identity of Donald Blake, and only recovered his identity as Thor after proving himself worthy of wielding [[Mjolnir (marvel)|]]. His archenemy is his adoptive brother [[Loki (marvel)|]]. He would later become a founding member of the [[Avengers (series)|]].

title: faucet
body:
Fixed device found in [[kitchen|kitchens]] and [[bathroom|bathrooms]] used for drawing water. Often paired with a [[sink]] or [[bathtub]]. May be installed outdoors for use with a [[hose]].

A common feature depicted of Japanese outdoor faucets is the ability to be turned facing upwards to be used for [[drinking]] or [[washing]] the face.

* !post #2356167

h4. See also

* [[Eyewash station]]

title: kabuto_juuzou
body:
An elderly fictional character from [[Mazinger Z]].

Doctor [b]Kabuto Juuzou[/b] is an old veteran [[scientist]]. 

He is [[Kabuto Kouji]]'s grandfather and the original creator of [[Mazinger Z (mecha)|]].

title: mucha_(mazinger)
body:
A character from the [[Mazinger Z]] [[super robot]] series.

One of [[Boss (mazinger z)|Boss']] cronies.

title: boss_(mazinger_z)
body:
A character from the [[Mazinger Z]] [[super robot]] series.

[b]Boss[/b] is the pilot of the [[Boss Borot]] robot.

He is a very big, [[fat]], strong and rude (but actually good hearted) Japanese young man. Initially a simple school bully, Boss later becomes a friend and ally of [[Kabuto Kouji]].

Always followed by his cronies [[Mucha (mazinger)|]] and [[Nuke (mazinger)|]].

body:

Conveniently, she gets especially turned on by being [[bondage|tied up]] and [[rape]]d.

title: traffic_mirror
body:
Traffic mirror or convex mirror (sometimes simply called a curved mirror) is a type of road safety mirror that's curved outwards. The purpose of this curved bulge is to expand the field that's visible in the reflection, making them ideal for improving road safety.

title: z'gok
body:
A fictional [[mecha]]  from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

[b]MSM-07 Z'Gok[/b]

The most successful amphibious [[mobile_suit|MS]] made by the Principality of [[Zeon]]. 

Its sturdy yet agile build, deadly claws, and powerful energy-based [[arm cannon]]s made it a formidable opponent even on the surface.

title: pandora_peaks
body: American, born April 12 1964. Former adult model and stripper, known for her incredibly large breasts and slim figure (her measurements in her prime were around 42HHH-22-36). Her most notable mainstream appearance was in the 1996 movie Striptease with Demi Moore, as the stripper Urbana Sprawl.

title: jockstrap
body:
A jockstrap is a type of [[male underwear]] designed for support and protection of male genitals, originally intended to be used in athletics or other activities requiring vigorous physical activity. It is comprised of an elastic waistband attached to a pouch (typically foam), with thigh bands to properly secure it in place.

While it has been mostly used as a utilitarian accessory, foamless or patterned variations have been made to emphasize its appeal as a fashionable and sexual garment. For this reason, both sports and fashion types are popular among gay males.

A counterpart to the jockstrap, known as a pelvic protector or a "jill", is similarly structured to cover female genitals.

h4. See also
* [[sportswear]] 
* [[print male underwear]]
* [[wet male underwear]]
* [[male underwear peek]]
* [[male underwear pull]]
* [[male underwear]]

title: final_fantasy_xiv
body:
Second [[Final Fantasy]] MMORPG by [[Square Enix]].

Initially a commercial and critical failure, the world of Final Fantasy XIV was temporarily shut down in an event known as the Seventh Umbral Calamity before being rebooted and relaunched as [i]Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn[/i], which takes place five years after. Since then, the game has received major critical acclaim both as an entry in the Final Fantasy series and an MMORPG, and has received five expansions. In Feburary 2022 [[Square Enix|SE Creative Studio III]] outlined plans for another 10 years of service.

title: tobal_no._1
body:
A 1996 fighting video game for the [[PlayStation 1|PlayStation]] developed by DreamFactory and published by Square. The game was DreamFactory's first release, as well as Square's first release on the CD-based console. Tobal No. 1 marks Square's first incursion into the fighting game genre, although an adventure-like quest mode is also part of the game. All the characters were designed by [[Toriyama Akira]].
Its 1997 sequel, [[Tobal 2]], was never released in North America and Europe.

title: tobal_2
body: A 1997 fighting video game developed by DreamFactory and released by Square for the [[PlayStation 1]]. It is the sequel to [[Tobal No. 1]]. Unlike its predecessor, it was not released outside Japan.

title: william_tecumseh_sherman
body:
[b]William Tecumseh Sherman[/b] (1820-1891) was a [[United States Army]] officer and general during the [[American Civil War]] and Indian Wars. 

He was the namesake for the famous [[M4 Sherman]] tank during [[World War II]].

title: atlanta_(city)
body:
The capital city of [[Georgia (state)|]] in the [[United States]], and the state's most populous city by far, with over half of Georgia's total population living in Atlanta's greater metro area. Originally built as a railroad town, Atlanta was almost entirely destroyed during the [[American Civil War]], and rebuilt practically from the ground up. 

Modern-day Atlanta is one of the largest economic centers of the Southeast US, with corporate headquarters to [[Coca-Cola]], [[Delta Airlines]], [[Arby's]], UPS, and more dominating the city's skyline. It is also well-known for film, television, and other productions, while its tech industry has gained the city the nickname "Silicon peach". Atlanta is also very famous for the sheer number and variety of sports teams and musical groups based in the city or originating from the city.

title: tuyu_(band)
body:
A music unit which consisted of guitarist, lyricist and composer Pusu, vocalist Rei, and pianist miro.

[[Omutatsu]] was also a member in charge of illustration until January 2022. [[Hutaba Haru]] illustrated most of the third album's music videos.
It was "disbanded on June 8th 2024":[https://x.com/TUYU_official/status/1799380850414330008] after "Pusu got arrested for attempted murder on his teenage girlfriend.":[https://web.archive.org/web/20240604073137/https://news.yahoo.co.jp/articles/76edeaddc390d0901555f7e8742979ecd917857c]

title: the_dark_urge_(baldur's_gate)
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]], exclusive to the player. Though the Dark Urge's race, gender, and appearance is entirely up to the player, their default appearance is a male white [[dragonborn (d&d)|dragonborn]] sorcerer. Unlike the custom Origin, playing as Dark Urge provides a predefined story and background, greatly affecting the narrative. Dark Urge's past is shrouded in mystery, save for a never-ending Urge to kill, maim, and murder. It is the player's choice on if they resist or indulge this Urge.

[spoilers]In reality, the Dark Urge is a Bhaalspawn, one who has been "gifted" with the blood of Bhaal, god of murder. The Urge is a result of this blood. Before the events of the game, the Dark Urge was the leader of the Cult of Bhaal and a serial murderer. They were previously in leagues with the game's three major antagonists, [[Ketheric Thorm]], [[Enver Gortash]], [[Orin the Red]], Orin being their subordinate, and the other two being collaborators. However, the three betrayed the Dark Urge, leading to a chain of events that would rob them of their memories and eventually to where the game's story begins.[/spoilers]

title: paramedic

title: pompey_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
A character and eventual boss from [[Zenless Zone Zero]], he was the leader of The Vanquishers and the previous Overlord of the Outer Ring Motor League. 

During the most recent Tour de Inferno, Pompey is betrayed by [[Lucius (zenless zone zero)|]], who tricked him into throwing a fake sparkstone into Cinder Lake, corrupting it with Ether. Pompey then confronts Lucius and injures him, though he had also been poisoned by Lucius beforehand, which lowers his Ether apititude. Pompey slowly corrupts into a powerful [[Ethereal (zenless zone zero)|]] and is eventually defeated by [[Caesar King (zenless zone zero)|]] and the rest of the Sons of Calydon. He was shown to be a just leader and overlord.

Pompey had [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[grey hair|grey]] and [[black hair]], a [[two-tone beard|two-tone]] [[grey beard|grey]] and [[black beard|black]] [[beard]], [[brown eyes]], multiple [[scar]]s [[scar on face|on his face]] and had a [[mature male|mature]] and [[muscular male|muscular]] build. He wore a [[black jacket|black]] [[collared jacket|collared]] [[leather jacket]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[compression shirt]] with a [[gold necklace]], [[two-tone gloves|two-tone]] [[grey gloves|grey]] and [[black gloves]], a [[grey belt]], [[two-tone pants|two-tone]] [[grey pants|grey]] and [[black pants]] and a pair of [[black boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #28733513: Human
* !asset #28732856: Corrupted

h4. See also

title: uss_atlanta_(cl-51)
body:
Class leader and name ship of the [i]Atlanta[/i]-class light cruisers of the [[United States Navy]], named for the [[Atlanta (city)|city of the same name]]. Commissioned just before Christmas, 1941, the vessel was awarded five Battle Stars for combat service during the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]]. 

While serving in the [[Guadalcanal campaign]], USS [i]Atlanta[/i] was crippled in combat action during the night of 13 November 1942, and was ordered to be scuttled the next morning. 

This tag is for depictions of the actual vessel, and for personifications outside of established franchises. 

h4. Depictions

* [[Atlanta (Kancolle)]] 
* [[Atlanta (Azur Lane)]] 
* [[Atlanta (Warship Girls R)]] 
* [[Atlanta (Black Surge Night)]] 
* [[USS Atlanta (CL-51) (Battleship Girl)]] 

h4. [i]Atlanta[/i]-class cruisers

title: atlanta_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of USS [i]Atlanta[/i] (CL-51) of the United States Navy. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]].

She is tall with [[large breasts]], and has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[two side up]] hairstyle and [[grey eyes]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[garrison cap]] with the number 51 written on it, silver [[star earrings]], an [[anchor hair ornament]], a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] that reaches her thighs, a [[high-waist_skirt|high-waisted]] [[black skirt|black]] [[suspender skirt]] over it that also reaches her upper thighs. [[Garter straps]] are visible below her skirt, attached to two [[thigh strap]]s. She also wears [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder_footwear|rudder]] [[boots]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[partially fingerless gloves]] which expose only her thumb and index finger and cover the other fingers in a mitten-style. Her [[machinery]] includes four [[ship turret|turret]]s and a [[crane_(machine)|]].

She is cool, laid back, and even somewhat aloof and/or easily irritated, in contrast to many of the American shipgirls who came before her. She has a particular aversion to night battles and Japanese destroyers, [[Akatsuki (kancolle)|]] and [[Yuudachi (kancolle)|]] in particular, in reference to her historical fate. She is often compared to [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]], who also has brown hair and a similar haircut but a flat chest.

The historical [i]Atlanta[/i] was heavily damaged after sinking Japanese destroyer [[akatsuki (kancolle)|Akatsuki]] during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal. She was sunk on her captain's orders later on the same day.

h4. Appearance

title: forced_partners
body:
When two or more unwilling individuals are forced to participate in sexual acts with each other. 
This might be because of being [[bound together]] by restraints, being coerced, or because of being under (apparent) duress, such as being held [[at gunpoint]] or other [[threat]]s.

If any (but not all) of the participants [i]are[/i] willing, you should probably use the [[rape]] tag instead.
Avoid using this tag when the participants are merely under [[hypnosis]] or [[mind control]], unless their powerless "inner selves" are also portrayed witnessing the scene. 

h4. See also

* [[forced]]
* [[rape]]
* [[bisexual female]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Rape by proxy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape_by_proxy

title: big_daddy_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
An unreleased character from [[Zenless Zone Zero]], he is a [[boar boy|boar thiren]] who is the founder and previous leader of the Sons of Calydon.

Big Daddy originally lived in the old capital Eridu and moved to the Outer Ring after it was swallowed by [[hollow (zenless zone zero)|Hollow Zero]]. There, he met [[Billy Kid]] and a young [[Caesar King (zenless zone zero)|]] and joined the biker gang Calydon, which was lead by Caesar's father. 

After Caesar's father vanished, the gang imploded and Big Daddy took on the role of her guardian and raised her. He founded the Sons of Calydon as homage to the previous gang. Sometime later, he met [[Lighter (zenless zone zero)|]] and paid off his debts, giving him a [[red scarf]] in the process. Seeing his skill, he asked him to join and fight for the gang. 

Eventually, Big Daddy retired from being the gang's leader and let Caesar King take over, though he still acts as a manager for them.

Big Daddy has [[long hair|long]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[white hair]] and a [[white facial hair|white]] [[beard]]. Being a boar thiren, he has [[boar ears]], a [[pig nose]], [[tusks]] and [[red skin]]. He wears a [[black jacket|black]] [[studded jacket|studded]] [[leather jacket]], a [[blue bandana]] [[bandana around neck|around his neck]], [[torn pants|torn]] [[black pants]], a [[thigh strap]], [[thigh holster]] and a pair of [[brown boots]] with [[spurs]]. He also has a pair of dark [[sunglasses]] obscuring his eyes, [[ear piercing|piercings]] in his [[animal ear piercing|left ear]], [[black gloves]] and a [[spiked bracelet|spiked]] [[gold bracelet]] on each arm. He dual wields a [[machete]] and a [[shotgun]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Zenless Zone Zero characters]]

h4. External links

* "Zenless Zone Zero Wiki: Big Daddy":https://zenless-zone-zero.fandom.com/wiki/Big_Daddy

title: yabi_fashion
body:
A Chinese youth subculture associated with the underground music scene that arose in the late 2010s, borrowing heavily from [[Y2K fashion]] and [[streetwear]]. Yabi literally means "subculture bitch", and is a rebellious movement emphasizing personal expression.

It has an eclectic and maximalist appearance, and is primarily based in the deconstruction and reappropriation of existing styles into something different.

h4. Examples

* !post #9406399
* !post #9212745
* !post #7910907
* !post #9037932

h4. See also

title: 2000s_(style)
body:
Anime or manga art styles that were popular during the 2000s. This tag should not be used for images created in the 2000s that do not fall into this specific art style.

Western artists with a fondness for this style tend to tag their artwork as "animecore":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Animecore, a term coined in Tumblr aesthetic communities in the late 2010s to refer to the imagery and culture surrounding anime in the 2000s.

h4. Common characteristics

* Bold black lineart
* [[anime coloring|Animation cel]] style shading
* Soft, pillowy shading with no defined form
* Freeform-shaped, "glossy" hair highlights with a low opacity 
* "Moe" proportions (large eyes, small dot noses, low-placed mouths)
* Eyes without a defined pupil, instead being blurred with a darker shade or having a loose freeform shaped shadow
* Solid, round eye catchlights
* Common geometric eye shapes like [[jitome]] or [[tsurime]]
* Sharp, [[thick eyelashes|thick]], upturned eyelashes
* Stereotypical anime expressions ([[>_<]], [[:3]], [[blush stickers]] and lines, exaggerated [[sweatdrop]]s)
* Hair drawn with sharp shapes

Shoujo art is typically traditional media, particularly [[colored pencil (medium)|]] or [[watercolor (medium)|]]. Eyes are more rounded and detailed. [[Sparkle]]s are frequently used.

h4. Examples

* !post #1276096: A 2000s style commonly seen in shoujo manga
* !post #117911: A 2000s style commonly seen in anime and visual novels
* !post #7939968: Modern artwork in a 2000s style
* !post #7767789: Modern artwork inspired by 2000s styles

h4. Specific style parodies

* [[Barasui (style)|]]
* [[kei (keigarou) (style)|KEI]]
* [[Koge Donbo (style)|]]
* [[Nakahara An (style)|]]
* [[POP (electromagneticwave) (style)|POP]]
* [[Ryukishi07 (style)|]]
* [[Watanabe Akio (style)|]]

h4. See also

* [[1990s (style)]]
* [[y2k fashion]]

title: baltimore_ravens
body:
An NFL Team based in Baltimore, Maryland. Currently owned by Steve Bisciotti. Founded in 1996. The Ravens have won 2 Superbowls, once in 2000, and another in 2012.

Their primary colors are Black, Purple and Gold. Their uniforms generally have the [[maryland flag]] on the shoulders.

Notable players include Ray Lewis, Joe Flacco, Anquan Boldin, [[Lamar jackson]] and Derick Henry.

title: taiyou_sentai_sun_vulcan
body:
The 5th [[Super Sentai]] series.

The final [[Marvel]] co-production, ending the partnership that started with the 1978 [[Spider-Man (toei)|]] adapation. The earliest Sentai show to receive a pitch for an American adaptation, manifesting as a "dubbed sizzle reel":[https://www.inverse.com/article/29187-power-rangers-movie-margaret-loesch-marvel-saban] that has "yet to become available to the public":[https://lostmediawiki.com/Taiyo_Sentai_Sun_Vulcan_(lost_Marvel_pilot;_1980s)]. Margaret Loesch, who had worked with Marvel for the pitch, would eventually help in the greenlighting of Saban's [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] for Fox.
other_names: 太陽戦隊サンバルカン

title: zordon
body:
One of the original characters created for [[Power Rangers]], appearing from [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] to [[Power Rangers in Space]] as an active character. The span of shows where he acted as a significant plot-related character (whether as a mentor per Mighty Morphin Power and Alien Rangers, or not) would result in this part of the Saban Era becoming known as the Zordon Age.

His name would be recycled from a similar sounding name from the Americanized [[Choudenshi Bioman]] pilot, which referred to the main antagonist, Doctor Man, as Zadar, with the Mighty Morphin pilot turning it into Zoltar, before finally becoming Zordon (along with the mechas going from Droids to Zords, derived from the word 'sword', per [[Dino Megazord]]'s sword).
other_names: ゾードン(パワーレンジャー)

title: nanase_yukika
body:

h4. Appearance

Her [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[very long hair]] is tied into a [[low ponytail|low]] [[ponytail]] and decorated with a [[red hairband|red]] [[hairband]] and a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow|bow]]. She also has [[crossed bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]] and [[red eyes]].

In her daily life, she wears the [[Mizuna Girls' Academy school uniform]] paired with [[purple thighhighs|purple]] [[thighhighs]] with a [[single stripe]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she wears [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[rabbit ears]], a [[red collar|red]] [[animal collar]] with a [[chain]] and a [[red gemstone|red]] [[heart|heart-shaped]] [[heart-shaped gem|gem]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[breast pocket]]s, a pair of [[wrist cuffs]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], a [[grey coat|grey]] [[sleeveless coat|sleeveless]] [[tailcoat]] with [[lapels]], a [[black corset|black]] [[corset]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]], [[red thighhighs|red]] [[argyle thighhighs|argyle]] [[thighhighs under boots|thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[ankle boots|ankle]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[boots]]. She fights using a [[rapier]].

* !asset #23411284

Her [[Doppel (madoka magica)|]] form is [[Poker Alice]].

She is voiced by [[Sumi Tomomi Jiena]], and was designed by [[Masu Gitsune]]/[[Kawazukuu]] duo.

title: nurse_robot_type_t
body:
[b]Nurse Robot Type T[/b] (Stylized as [b]NurseRobot_TypeT[/b]) is an original character designed and voiced by artist [[SuteinuA]] (a.k.a. Matsuo Kayu). She received [[UTAU]], [[COEIROINK]], [[CoeFont]] [[VOICEVOX]], and [[VOCALOID]] voicebanks. She has several nicknames: TT (from her full name), the Little Nurse (小护士), and Taotie (饕餮).

TT has [[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes]], [[short hair]] with both [[side braids]]. As her name, she is a nurse wearing [[nurse cap]], white [[sleeveless dress]] and golves with white back and black front. Sometimes she wears [[lab coat]], or takes a pair of huge [[tank_(container)|tanks]]. Her obviously [[mechanical legs]] showing she is an [[android]].

A notable change of TT's character design is that new red [i][[shamrock]][/i] (or [i][[four-leaf clover]][/i]) mark on her nurse cap had replaced [[red cross]] in old design.

h4. See also

* [[Nurse Robot Type T (VOCALOID6)]]

title: lost_sword:_tales_of_britania
body:
A 2D autobattler gacha game developed by Code Cat and published by Wemade Connect. It officially released in South Korea on January 16, 2025 and globally on July 20, 2025.

[b]"Lost Sword"[/b] is an isekai narrative loosely based around the [[Arthurian legend]]. Players mainly follow a 4-person party traveling the continent of Britannia to find a legendary sword named [[Excalibur (mythology)|]]. This party consists of:

* Ethan - The player character. He is a South Korean jobseeker who found himself in Britannia due to mysterious circumstances. He currently holds the title of Swordbringer, a chosen one who would assist the rightful wielder of the Excalibur in their search for it.
* [[Elizabeth Pendragon (Lost Sword)|]] - Daughter of former Britannian king Uther Pendragon and an analogue for [[King Arthur]]. She is searching for Excalibur in order to use its power to take back the kingdom from the hands of the kingslayer and betrayer Vortigern.
* [[Morgana (Lost Sword)|]] - The Fairy Queen and an analogue for [[Morgan le Fay]]. She is currently accompanying Ethan due to his role as the Swordbringer. Much older than her peers due to her having the ability to endlessly reincarnate upon death, but she's become a bit of a NEET due to some of her experiences.
* [[Bedivere (Lost Sword)|]] - Elizabeth's retainer and closest friend. Ditzy and kind of gullible, but her expertise with the bow and arrow and her healing magic makes her a powerful ally to the party.

h4. External links

* [https://lostsword.wemadeconnect.com/EN/m/index.html#Main](Official English website)

title: touka_(summer_redo)
body:
Third and final female protagonist who met male protagonist of doujinshi series [[Natsu no Yari Naoshi (Summer Redo)]] by [[Keiji Asakawa]].

Mother of [b][[Suiren_(summer_redo)|]][/b] and [b][[Aoi_(summer_redo)|]][/b], [spoiler]she worked in the school during protagonist childhood were she became his first love. At the end, she broke the engagement of her oldest daughter and was raped by her youngest daughter with a dildo later in the series. Divorced from her husband after discover his affair.[/spoiler]

She is the cover girl and main character on issues "#4":[/posts/9657351] and "#5":[/posts/9657353] (the story focuses only in her but her daughters also has a role in "plot's development" :ReinSmile:), however, she have a cameo on last pages of issue "#3":[/posts/9657349].

title: merem_solomon's_demon_of_the_right_arm
body:
The Daemon of the Right Arm (右腕の悪魔, Migiude no Akuma?), classified as Lady Windup (機巧令嬢, Kikō Reijō?), is a ten-meter tall mechanical doll. It is the manifestation of weapons of war, combat, and puppets. He designed it after the duality of angels and daemons. It is armed with diverse weaponry, though it is only fit with the types of weapons that a single individual could use as [[Merem Solomon|Merem’s]] personal rule. It also acts as a mobile fortress with an entrance and a set of stairs on its stomach to allow access to its interior. As a symbol of armaments, it is the only Beast to have been shaped through modifications in order to keep up with the advancements in the field of warfare. Its latest configuration has been established for one hundred years. Its face is normally covered with a mask that is rarely removed, and it has a limited amount of intelligence and a stubborn personality. It will quickly perform the first command given with the utmost priority, ignoring anything unrelated, but will quickly become disinterested and ignore subsequent orders. Due to these traits, Merem dislikes using it.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9657722: Profile

h4. External links

* "TypeMoon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Merem_Solomon

title: pearl_(splatoon)
body:
[[Splatoon 2]] character. Named [b]Hime[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[Inkling]].

She is part of the band Off The Hook (Tentacles in the Japanese version) with [[Marina (splatoon)|]], which has its own television show.

Her Japanese name comes from the word for the "Northern pygmy squid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idiosepius_paradoxus (ヒメイカ [i]Hime-ika[/i]). As revealed in Octotune's album booklet, her full name is [b]Pearl Houzuki [/b] in English; [b]Hime Houzuki[/b] ([b]ホウズキ・ヒメ[/b]) in Japanese.

In her default costume & appearance she wears a [[white dress]], [[pink pantyhose]], black [[fingerless gloves]], white [[shoes]] and a [[crown]]. She has [[thick eyebrows]] and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. She has white / yellow [[star-shaped pupils]]. While she typically has [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[white hair|white]] + [[pink hair]], the white part is sometimes drawn more [[blonde hair|blonde]].

title: sukuna_shinmyoumaru
body:
The "Descendant of the Inchlings"

Final boss of [i][[Double Dealing Character]][/i], the fourteenth cardinal [[Touhou]] game. She is based on, and is a descendant of, [[Issun-Boushi]]. Became playable in [i][[Urban Legend in Limbo]][/i] and [i][[Antinomy of Common Flowers]][/i]. Usually shown as friendly and good-natured, especially compared to her ally [[Kijin Seija]]. She fights with a [[holding sewing needle|sewing needle]] and [[miracle mallet]].

She is a [[minigirl]] with [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Often seen wearing a [[bowl hat]] and a [[red kimono]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves|wide sleeved]] and a [[black sash|black]] [[obi]] while going [[barefoot]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Shinmyoumaru_Sukuna

title: hazure_skill_"mapping"_wo_te_ni_shita_shounen_wa_saikyou_party_to_dungeon_ni_idomu
body:
An 8 volume fantasy light novel series by Udon Kamono and illustrated by [[mephisto_(angraecum)|Hitomi Shizuki]].

English title: Mapping: The Trash-Tier Skill That Got Me Into a Top-Tier Party.

The series follows Note Athlon a young man who learns on his 15th birthday that he was gifted the skill "mapping" which is widely believed to be an inferior version of the skills "world map" and "area map."  Worse yet, this skill uses up all 3 of his skill slots so it is his only skill.  On the other hand his childhood friend who he has a crush on possesses 3 extremely powerful skills.  Due to the extreme difference in skills, his childhood friend abandons Note and he begins living his days full of misery struggling to earn money through adventuring.  All this changes when a young man named Jin appears before Note and tells him that his adventurer party need his skill.

h4. Characters

* Note Athlon
* Erin Fortlord
* Force Granz
* Jin
* Neme Pargin
* Roslia Minkgott
* Sofie
other_names: 外れスキル【地図化〈マッピング〉】を手にした少年は最強パーティーとダンジョンに挑む

title: proboscis
body: A proboscis is an elongated appendage from the head of an animal, either a vertebrate or an invertebrate. In invertebrates, the term usually refers to tubular mouthparts used for feeding and sucking. In vertebrates, a proboscis is an elongated nose or snout.

title: bruce_wayne
body:
A character from [[Batman (series)|]]. He is a wealthy American playboy, philanthropist, and owner of Wayne Enterprises, based in Gotham City. Son of [[Thomas Wayne]] and [[Martha Wayne]].

His alter ego is [[Batman]].

title: zack_snyder
body: Zachary Edward Snyder (born March 1, 1966) is an American film director, producer, and screenwriter. He made his feature film debut in 2004 with Dawn of the Dead, a remake of the 1978 horror film of the same name. Since then, he has directed or produced a number of comic book and superhero films, including [[300 (movie)|]] (2006) and Watchmen (2009), as well as the Superman film that started the [[DC Extended Universe]], [[Man of Steel]] (2013), and its follow-ups, [[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice]] (2016) and [[Justice League (movie)|]] (2017), as well as the director's cut of Justice League that was later released in 2021.

title: souryuu_asuka_langley
body:
A character from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], daughter of [[Souryuu Kyouko Zeppelin]].

She is a 14-year-old of mixed [[germany|German]] and [[Japan]]ese descent, and [[united_States|American]] by nationality. The red hot pilot of [[Eva 02|Evangelion Unit 02]], she is proud in nature and a tough girl with attitude. She is described as being [[tsundere]] for [[Ikari Shinji]] and the two may be considered a canon pairing as director [[Anno Hideaki]] has stated to prefer the two of them together. 

See {{Souryuu_Asuka_Langley Rebuild_of_Evangelion}} for Asuka Shikinami Langley from the [[Rebuild of Evangelion]] movies.

h4. See also

* [[ANTA BAKA?]] (Asuka's catchphrase)
* [[Feliz Jueves (meme)]]

title: neon_genesis_evangelion
body:
One of the most popular anime of all time on top of being a popular [[mecha]] series, created by [[Anno Hideaki]] initially with [[GAINAX]] and now with his company [[Studio Khara]]. It has mechanical designs by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] and character designs by [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]]. Evangelion was first released as a TV anime series in October 1995. 

Originally planned as a parody of the traditional [[super robot]] mecha anime genre tropes at the time (according to creator Anno), it surprisingly became an extremely successful and long lasting franchise despite its mentally and socially troubled protagonists [spoilers]and Anno's original intention to troll super robot mecha [[otaku]][/spoilers].

The [b]Evangelion[/b] franchise also spans the initial manga, and many spin-offs in various media.

title: jacket_girl_(dipp)
body: The "Jacket Girl" refers to the unnamed girl featured on the album cover (jacket) of [[Dolls In Pseudo Paradise]]. Officially, very little about her is known beyond her design. Originally, her design is monochrome, but fans have generally interpreted her to have [[blonde hair]] and black [[dress|clothes]]. She has [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy hair]] and wears a [[frilled hat]]. She is often depicted holding a [[cross]]. Some have interpreted her as being the sole woman from the group of Eight Honest Men (AKA The Pierrot), who succumbed to insanity and became a youkai, murdering her fellow Honest Men.
other_names: ジャケットイラストの娘

body:
Second female protagonist who met male protagonist of doujinshi series [b][[Natsu no Yari Naoshi (Summer Redo)]][/b] by [b][[Keiji Asakawa]][/b].

Youngest daughter of [b][[Touka_(summer_redo)|]][/b], as a school student, she is almost portrayed with her uniform but she also wears another kind of outfits, despite her age, she wears sexy lingerie [spoiler]and is the first one to deliver herself to the protagonist[/spoiler]. [spoiler]She raped her own mother in volume "#5":[/posts/9657353] using a dildo.[/spoiler]

She is the cover girl and main character in issues cover "#1":[/posts/9657345] and "#3":[/posts/9657349] sharing this last with her older sister, [b][[Suiren_(summer_redo)|]][/b].

title: top_gun:_maverick
body:
The 2022 sequel to the original 1986 [[Top Gun]]. [[Tom Cruise]] and Val Kilmer reprise their roles and are joined by [[Jennifer Connelly]] and [[Miles Teller]] among others. Deemed both a commercial and critical success.

In Japan, a collaboration was announced with [[Umamusume]] featuring [[Mayano Top Gun (Umamusume)|]] (whose [[mayano_top_gun_(racehorse) |namesake horse]] was named after the movie, and also whose personality is similar to that of a pilot from the film) as a special advertising pilot, including replacing Cruise's [[Pete "Maverick" Mitchell]] in an alternate official Japanese movie poster (Post #5348482, published on Twitter by both [i]Umamusume[/i] and the movie's Japanese Twitter account).

* !post #5348482: [[Umamusume]] collaboration poster featuring [[Mayano Top Gun (Umamusume)|]] as [[Pete "Maverick" Mitchell|Maverick]] ([[Tom Cruise]])
other_names: トップガン_マーヴェリック

title: kitajima_saburou
body:
Famous real-life Japanese [[enka]] singer, real name Oono Minoru ([b]大野 穣[/b], おおの みのる). Also songwriter and composer. And on-and-off actor. Makes regular appearances on NHK's annual New Year Eve's [i]Kouhaku Uta Gassen[/i] TV program, which features many different performances by various Japanese singers.

Also affectionately nicknamed "Sabu-chan". His most famous song (at least for modern generations) is arguably "Matsuri", due to it being sung on [i]Kouhaku Uta Gassen[/i].

Mr. Kitajima is also a successful owner of several thoroughbred racehorses, most famous among them being [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]]. He has dedicated several song performances to his horse, including penning an exclusive new song called "Arigatou, Kitasan Black" for Kitasan's retirement ceremony. 

Because of the above, Mr. Kitajima is sometimes drawn together with the [[Umamusume]] version of [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]], where he usually acts as an affectionate grandfather-like figure.

h4. See also

* [[Enka]]

h4. External links

* "Youtube: [i]Matsuri[/i]":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N87ikbj_1vo]
* "Youtube: [i]Matsuri[/i] at 2017 Arima Kinen":[https://youtu.be/14qeMSCgNCs?t=139]
* "Youtube: [i]Arigatou, Kitasan Black[/i]":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GjY5VJ2IrGU]

title: merem_solomon's_demon_of_the_left_leg
body:
The Daemon of the Left Leg (左足の悪魔, Hidariashi no Akuma?), classified as the King of the Sky (空の王者, Sora no Ōja?), is a manta ray-like daemon around two hundred meters in size. The concept behind its creation is that of freedom and shooting for the cosmos. It is considered to be his most beautiful creation with membranes composed of countless animal species. It "swims" through the skies and remains unmatched in the air, but will face destruction once it touches the ground. It is meant to be used in situations where one-on-one combat against a strong opponent is necessary, though it has a weak defense that will cause it to fade away after receiving severe damage. [[Merem Solomon|Merem]] believes that it is a great weapon with too high a cost to properly utilize.

https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Merem_Solomon

title: merem_solomon's_demon_of_the_left_arm
body:
The Daemon of the Left Arm (左腕の悪魔, Hidariude no Akuma?), classified as the King of Rats (ネズミの王様, Nezumi no Ōsama?), is a daemon without any abilities related towards battle. He is the manifestation of [[Merem Solomon|Merem's]] wish to become others, the hope to transform, and he was designed after a friend of Merem who lived in the ceiling of his temple. He is a rat who is capable of transforming into anything that resembles the size and shape of a human, allowing him to act Merem's representative in human society under the guise of an elderly priest due to Merem being in the unaging form of a boy. It is his preferred persona despite his ability to transform into a myriad of people. He even acts as if he is Merem himself to all the other members of the Burial Agency besides [[Narbareck]] and Ciel because the organization values experience, with Merem believing that his true form would bring about unnecessary trouble. [[Ciel (Tsukihime)|]] calls the priest "wise and cool" compared to Merem's more childlike personality. If ever brought under the gaze of a high-class exorcist, his facade will be undone and cause him to return to its original form.

Despite being intrinsically linked, they are not able to communicate telepathically. Should Merem leave the Left Arm behind with Narbareck, he must communicate with rats using his ability to speak to animals in order to relay messages. He is able to obtain information from them and relay messages to the Left Arm. They act reverently towards Merem, and consider the Left Arm to be the hero and idol of the rat world, thought of as the "third most beautiful rat in the world." He is popular in communities in narrow spaces underground, on ceiling boards, in drainage conduits, and behind furniture. Despite his fame, they often point out the contradiction in his status by asking "Just what part of you is a 'Great' Daemon Beast?", leaving him troubled while apologetically trying to think of an answer, or not. He is a cheese lover who likes humans because of pizza, and works daily at a relaxed pace for the sake of Merem, humans, and rats.

https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Merem_Solomon

title: aka_manto
body:
Any reference to the Red Cloak, a spirit from [[Japanese urban legends|Japanese urban legend]].

A masked spirit wearing a red cloak haunts public bathrooms, asking occupants of stalls a question. Typically, the Red Cloak reaches under the stall and asks if the occupant would like a red item or blue item (such as toilet paper). Choosing either option results in the occupant's death.

h4. See also

* [[Chanchanko (clothes)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aka_Manto]

title: chanchanko_(clothes)
body:
A type of traditional Japanese vest that is worn over other clothing.

It is often mixed up with other stuffed garments like the [[hanten (clothes)|]], dotera or tanzen, but is easily told apart because it has no sleeves.
It was mostly used as clothing for kids, but there is a custom for people who are celebrating reaching 60 years of age to wear a red chanchanko. This custom has become less popular in recent times.

Some well-known characters who wear chanchanko are:

* [[Kitarou]] from [[Gegege no Kitarou]]
* [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]] from [[Umamusume]]
* [[Mito Mitsukuni]] from [[Mito Koumon]]

They also appear in a [[Japanese urban legends|Japanese urban legend]] called the "Red chanchanko", a variant of "”Red Paper or Blue Paper”":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aka_Manto#The_legend].

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: urasekai_picnic
body:
A sci-fi/fantasy novel series authored by Miyazawa Iori, with a manga illustrated by [[Mizuno Eita]]. A Winter 2021 anime was produced by Liden Films and Felix Film.

The premise involves a pair of university students, [[Kamikoshi Sorawo]] and [[Nishina Toriko]], exploring a parallel world known as the Otherside, where various entities based on urban legends and folklore can be found.

title: turbo_baachan
body:
Turbo Baachan, literally "Turbo Granny", is a [[monster]] from [[Japanese urban legends]]. This [[old woman]] appears on roads prone to fatal driving errors, such as inside tunnels or in mountains at night, and startles the driver by running parallel to the moving car.
There are countless variations to the name and appearance, but all contain some kind of humorous element. Names combined with the traffic law's speed limit such as "xx km/h Babaa (old hag)" are especially popular.
Stories of the monster directly attacking the spectators are surprisingly few, and almost all of the damage done to drivers are from driving errors resulting from the shock.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article (JP)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ターボばあちゃん

title: sukima_onna
body:
隙間女 ([i]Sukima onna[/i], literally "gap woman") is a [[Japanese urban legends|Japanese urban legend]], and also the name of the entity itself.

A woman (there’s also a male version) was living alone, and when she was in her room she sometimes felt like someone was watching her. This room was on the third floor so it was hard to believe anyone could be looking in from outside. She searched the house but of course she didn't find anyone hiding in any of the rooms, and didn't see any holes in the walls either. And then one day, she found the person who had been staring. It was a woman standing in the several-millimeter gap between the drawer and wall in her room, and she was still staring at her...

The Japanese comedian and actor, "Sakura Kinzou,":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A1%9C%E9%87%91%E9%80%A0 is also known for telling ghost stories; this story is his representative work. His version is the following kind of story.

Kinzou's coworker didn't come to work so he visited the house and asked his coworker what happened. He said “I was told by ‘her’ not to go." When the narrator asked where ‘she’ was, he pointed towards the kitchen. And when the narrator looked into the kitchen, he saw a woman with a flattened body standing in the small gap between the refrigerator and the wall.

"Mimi-bukuro,":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%80%B3%E5%9A%A2 a collection of pieces written in the Edo period by "Negishi Shizumori,":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A0%B9%E5%B2%B8%E9%8E%AE%E8%A1%9B contains a similar story:
A successful [[wagashi]] storekeeper moved into a new home.  After that, something was wrong with the sliding door on the second floor. When a servant tried to open it, it only opened halfway for some reason. When the storekeeper tried the door opened without any problem. The next day it wouldn't open, so one of the servants forced it open. Suddenly a woman appeared from the tight space for containing the door and grabbed at the servant. He panicked and forced her back, and she vanished.

h4. See also

* [[Yakumo Yukari]], a [[Touhou]] character loosely based on this creature.
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 隙間女":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%9A%99%E9%96%93%E5%A5%B3

title: hylia
body:
A character from the backstory of [[The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword]].  

[spoiler]She was the goddess the creator gods entrusted with protecting the [[Triforce]].  

Long before the events of Skyward Sword, [[Demise (zelda)|]] attacked, and was sealed away, while Hylia sent the humans to the sky.

She then shed her divinity to reincarnate as a mortal, so she could use the Triforce to deal with Demise once and for all.

Her human form is [[Princess Zelda]].[/spoiler]

title: high_wizard_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The transcendent version of the [[Wizard (ragnarok online)|]] from [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can equip a [[holding staff|staff]] or a [[holding wand|wand]], but sometimes are seen with a [[holding book|book]]. Named characters: [[Kathryne Keyron]], [[Wizard of Veritas]]

Males wear a [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[red capelet]] with a [[high collar]], [[brown wings]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[white gloves]], [[white pants]], and [[white shoes]].
Females wear a [[fur-trimmed cape|fur-trimmed]] [[brown cape]], a [[brown dress|brown]] [[two-tone dress|and]] [[white dress|white]] [[layered dress|layered]] [[short dress]] with [[strapless dress|no straps]], [[fur-trimmed gloves|fur-trimmed]] [[brown gloves]], and [[brown boots|brown]] [[two-tone boots|and]] [[white boots]]. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #7298068
* !post #7298070

title: psychic_miku_(project_voltage)
body:
A character design by [[take (takegarou)|]] for the [[Pokemon]] and [[Vocaloid]] collaboration [[Project Voltage]] that imagines [[Hatsune Miku]] as a Psychic-type Pokemon trainer. Her Pokemon partner is [[Meloetta (Aria)|Meloetta]].

Psychic Miku has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair]] that [[multicolored hair|switches]] between [[aqua hair|aqua]] and [[green hair|green]]. Her hair is styled as [[twintails]] with some of it [[hair between eyes|reaching between her eyes]]. She wears a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]], a [[white headwear|white]] [[beanie]], [[headphones]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[polo shirt]] with a [[collared shirt|collar]] and [[short sleeves]], a [[single glove|single]] [[white gloves|white glove]] on her right hand, a [[bracelet]] on her left hand, a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[grey skirt]], [[blue socks]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]]. She also carries a [[blue bag|blue]] [[piano print]] [[shoulder bag]] which has a [[bag charm]] as well as various badge pins attached to it.

h4. Official art

* !post #6654571

title: night_maiden_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Night Maidens[/b] are enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They are one of the female counterparts to the [[Nox Monk]]s, found in the Eternal Cities. The other being the [[Swordstress (elden ring)|]]. Nightmaidens are tall females with greyish brown skin, and wears brown scaly armor with fancy white drapery, wielding a dagger and spews a deadly mist.

They can be identified by their two-pronged [[escoffion]], while the [[Swordstress (elden ring)|]]es wear a tall, conical [[hennin]].

title: swordstress_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Swordstresses[/b] are enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. They are one of the female counterparts to the [[Nox Monk (elden ring)|]]s, found in the Eternal Cities. The other being the [[Night Maiden (elden ring)|]]s. Swordstresses are tall females with greyish brown skin, and wears brown scaly armor with fancy white drapery, wielding a liquid-metal sickle that can elongate into a whip. Some of them are found riding giant hypnotized ants.

They can be identified by their tall, conical [[hennin]], while the [[Night Maiden (elden ring)|]]s wear a two-pronged [[escoffion]].

title: nessa_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Nessa[/b], known as [b]Rurina[/b] (ルリナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Gym Leader from Galar is also a popular model. She grew up playing with Water-type Pokémon thanks to her parents’ influence and is good friends with [[Sonia (pokemon)|]].

She has  [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[aqua eyes|aqua]]/[[blue eyes]] with [[blue eyeshadow|eyeshadow]], and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[black hair|black]] and [[aqua hair]] with a [[single hair bun|bun]]. She wears [[hoop earrings|earrings]] and an [[earclip]], a [[necklace]], an [[armlet]], a [[belly chain]], [[bike shorts|spats]], a [[dynamax band|wristband]], [[single glove|a]] [[partially fingerless gloves|glove]], and [[white sandals]].

title: vera:_garnet_(wavebender)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Vera (pgr)|]]'s [[vera: garnet (pgr)|Garnet frame]].

Wavebender coating is a summer apparel for the Garnet frame, no mechanical bodily features, and major changes to her hair style. Wavebender coating features [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|red]] and [[blue hair]] though primarily red, with blue coloured [[colored inner hair|inner hair]] and blue [[streaked hair|streaks]], styled with [[asymmetrical bangs]] and a single [[braid]] behind left ear, adorned with two [[hairclip]]s. Wears a pair of [[sunglasses]], a [[white headwear|white]] [[newsboy cap]] and has two [[fish skeleton earrings]].

Upper body apparel consist of a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[see-through jacket|see-through]] [[open jacket]], and a [[red bikini|red]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] fabric/collar covering her chest. Lower body has a pair of [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]] with [[suspenders]]. Foot wear is a pair of [[white boots|white]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[high heel boots]].

title: golf_pauline
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Pauline (Mario)|Pauline]] in the [[Mario Golf]] series. Depicted wearing a [[red shirt|red]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with [[black pants]], as well as a [[red headwear|red]] [[newsboy cap]], [[red gloves]], a [[purple belt]], and [[white sneakers]].

title: seaborn_(arknights)
body:
Non-human lifeforms born of the ocean, initiators of the Profound Silence. They have a very short evolutionary cycle to deal with hostile creatures and the environment. To this day, they continue to threaten Ægir and the coasts of Iberia.

The Seaborn are hyper-adaptive aquatic creatures hailing from the abyss of Terra's oceans. They evolve incredibly fast and possess the ability to mutate their own somatic cells without relying on generational heredity.

title: allister_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Allister[/b], known as [b]Onion[/b] (オニオン) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon swsh|Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Ghost-type Gym Leader keeps his face hidden behind a mask and has one hundred copies of it. He likes to be alone in places like ancient ruins and graveyards [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Gengar]].

He has [[pale skin]], [[purple eyes]] with [[bright pupils]], and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. He wears a [[mask]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[black shirt|shirt]], [[single glove|a]] [[partially fingerless gloves|glove]], [[side slit shorts|side-slit]] [[suspender shorts|suspender]] [[black shorts|shorts]], [[white socks]], and [[white shoes]].

title: serizane-chan_(paru_rari)
body:
[[Serizawa Serizane]]'s [[original]] character.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[pink hair]] and [[heterochromia]] - a [[yellow eyes|yellow]] and a [[green eyes|green]] eye.
She typically has a [[single sidelock]], [[hair between eyes|bangs between her eyes]] and a [[high ponytail|high]] [[ponytail]], all decorated with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|bow]] and a series of [[hairpin]]s, two of which are [[x hair ornament|crossed]].

Her main outfit consists of [[heart earrings|heart]]-and-[[ribbon earrings|ribbon]] [[earrings]], [[ear piercing]]s, a [[pink collar|pink]] [[animal collar|animal]] [[collar]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[shirt]] with an [[open collar|open]] [[collared shirt|collar]] and [[breast pocket]]s, a [[black necktie|black]] [[necktie]] with a [[tie clip]], a pair of [[suspenders]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[miniskirt]], a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[cross-laced sleeves]] worn [[off shoulder]], a [[leg belt]], a single [[fishnet socks|fishnet sock]], a pair of [[pink socks|pink]] [[ankle socks]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]].

Many ribbons in her outfit spell "REAL ANGEL".

title: kiana_kaslana_(herrscher_of_finality)
body:
One of the playable [[official alternate costume|battlesuits]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]]. Released in December 2022, this is the last of Kiana's battlesuits to be revealed for the game's Part 1.

In her original Herrscher of Finality form, she is portrayed with [[blue eyes]] with pink [[diamond-shaped pupils]]. Her outfit consists of an elaborate [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] adorned with multiple [[black flower]]s, [[frills|frilled]] arm pieces, single white [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, [[single sock|single]] [[white socks|white sock]] on her left, and [[white shoes]]. 

Her [[Kiana Kaslana (APHO)|Post-Honkai]] version replaces the neck flowers with a proper [[detached collar]] while her dress changes to a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] white-[[purple dress]] with white [[detached sleeves]]. Her tiara is likewise replaced with a black [[hairband]] tied to her left.  

Her [[official alternate hairstyle]] is a [[high ponytail]], while she gains additional [[blue hair|blue]]-[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in her Post-Honkai version.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6061177: Default, as revealed
* !post #8627092: [[Kiana Kaslana (APHO)|Post-Honkai version]]
* !post #6384681: [[Kiana Kaslana (Selenic Ripples)|Selenic Ripples]]
* !post #6495719: [[Kiana Kaslana (Summer 2023)|2023 Swimsuit]]
* !post #6664577

title: regis_altare
body:
A [[Holostars English|Holostars EN]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], and leader of [[holoTEMPUS]]. Character design by [[Kurahana Chinatsu]].

Altare has [[blue hair]] and [[green eyes]]. He's the shortest member of TEMPUS HQ at 179cm, something he doesn't like being reminded of.

His default attire consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[grey vest]] with a blue top, a [[white jacket|white]] [[hoodie]], [[white belt]], [[black pants]], and [[white shoes]]. He also wields a combined sword-gun as his main weapon.

title: single-shoulder_sweater
body:
A sweater with an asymmetrical, diagonal-shaped neckline, leaving a portion of the upper chest area and at least one shoulder [[bare shoulders|bare]]. These sweaters are typically supported by a [[single sleeve]] or a [[single strap]] on one shoulder while the other is left bare. The neckline of the sweater starts on top of one shoulder ends underneath the armpit between the torso and opposite arm.

title: lingerie
body:
Lingerie in modern parlance refers to fashionable and often alluring undergarments worn by women. Typically the design will be more exotic/risque, accentuated with pronounced decorative (lace or frill) trim, or is made out of special fabrics, such as silk, which may or may not be [[see-through clothes|sheer]].

Most undergarment tags are [b]not[/b] set to imply lingerie.  It should be manually applied by the appearance of the undergarment(s) as above, and perhaps according to the situation by which they are revealed, not ubiquitously tagged with the mere appearance of [[panties]] or flashed [[bra]] worn for everyday purposes. For these undergarments and more, see [[underwear]].
H4. Lingerie vs. Ordinary Underwear

title: shedinja
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0292 in the National Pokédex, a Bug/Ghost-type.

The discarded [[exoskeleton]] of a [[Nincada]], left behind when it evolves into [[Ninjask]]. It has a [[halo]], a hole in its back, and is always [[floating]].

Along with its unusual obtention method, this Pokémon is notable for being the only one with a HP base stat of 1, and its "Wonder Guard" ability, which protects it from any attack that isn't super-effective.

Japanese name: [b]Nukenin[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9416260

title: gekota
body:
A franchise of anthropomorphic frogs found in merchandise marketed to children in the [[ToAru Majutsu no Index]] universe. [[Misaka Mikoto]] is a huge fan of the franchise, which - much to her consternation - gets her labeled as childish. Other Gekota fans (gekoers / ゲコラー) include [[Hokaze Junko]] and [[Iizumi Rita]].

h4. Characters

* [[Gekota (character)]]. He is colored in green, has a [[black facial hair|black]] [[mustache]] and wears a [[black suit]]. He is an old man type of character who is known to suffer from motion sickness easily. Because he has a habit of saying geko-geko (ゲコ, ゲコ), the name stuck and he's been referred to as such ever since.
* [[Keroyon (ToAru)|]] (ケロヨン). Also green, but doesn't wear anything. Has [[:>]] expression. He lives next to Gekota.
* [[Pyonkichi (ToAru)|]] (ピョン吉). Is red colored. Doesn't wear anything.
* [[Pyonko]] (ピョン子, Yen Press: Hoppit). She is pink colored and often seen with a [[red bow]] [[head bow|on her head]].
* [[Rainbow Gekota]]. "I'll give [[Febrie|her]] this rare among rares, with a one in 60 chance of getting one... My rainbow Gekota!" — Misaka Mikoto.

To cause a loss of pride, self-respect, or dignity. This tag is equally applicable to [[bullying]] or fetish content.

Some common humiliation actions can fall under [[public nudity]], [[abuse]], [[rape]], [[body writing]], being treated as a [[pet play|pet]], or [[recording]] someone in a compromising situation.

A character should look [[embarrassed]] or upset by the action, or appear to visibly be degraded by it. 

In most cases where a character is enthusiastically consenting with whatever is happening, the humiliation tag likely does not apply.

title: ningbo
body:
Ningbo is a secondary antagonist featured in the ninth part of the [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[The JOJOLands]].

He is a [[firefighter]] affiliated with HOWLER Company who works together with [[Key West]] and [[Laem Chabang]] to either find Lulu or the culprits going after HOWLER's assets. Ningbo is also a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user who wields [[200 ballons (jojo)|]], a [[Stand (jojo)|]] with the ability to inflate its targets.

Ningbo is a man with large, round eyes, and small irises. He is sometimes shown with very thin eyebrows, though usually appears as if he lacks them. He is [[bald]], and wears a round fire [[helmet]] with a prominent light fixture on the front, a visor on top of it, and a neck guard in the back. The helmet has a strip that extends toward his nose, similar to a nose guard on a nasal helmet. He usually displays a sharp gaze with a neutral expression.

He is dressed in a heavy, double-breasted trench coat with wide lapels and a loose fit, giving him a bulky silhouette. The coat is secured with five circular buttons running down the front on each side, resembling screws.

title: 200_ballons_(jojo)
body:
200 Balloons is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Ningbo]], featured in the ninth part of the [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[The JOJOLands]].

It allows [[Ningbo]] to inflate anything he touches like a [[balloon]].

200 Balloons is humanoid with an overweight, lumpy build shaped like a balloon. Its head is rounded, wearing a cap with a diamond-shaped protrusion on the top. The cap has open slits above its eyes, pointing toward the center. A small, dark circle is also present on the bottom center of its cap. Its large, oval-shaped eyes are segmented and it has a smile. The Stand notably has prominently puffed, balloon-like cheeks, which appear inflated.

A dark vertical mark runs down the center of its forehead, stopping at the center of its face. The vertical mark starts again below its mouth to its chin. It has a plain body, segmented forearms resembling puffer jacket sleeves, circular knuckle markings, knee pads, and boots. Its legs are very short compared to the length of its arms.

title: vocaloid
body:
VOCALOID is a DTM (Desktop Music) singing synthesizer engine developed by [[Yamaha]] Corporation in collaboration with Pompeu Fabra University. 

VOCALOID products are created by various individual studios that develop voicebanks using the most current engine tools. The first set of synthesizer vocals was released in January 2004.

On August 31st, 2007, [[Hatsune Miku]] was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. As the first product in Crypton Future Media's Character Vocal Series, she was the first voicebank designed with an anime-styled avatar representing the singer of the voicebank. Her immediate and immense popularity led to nearly all future voicebanks following the same trend of having an anime-styled avatar, a trend that still continues to this day.

The popularity of VOCALOID has inspired the creation of [[List of vocal synthesizers|similar products]].

h4. See also

title: nightfall_(armored_core_vi)
body:
The poster AC [[mecha]] of [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], featured in box arts and the teaser trailer, also available as a scale figure in the game's Collector's Edition.

Nightfall is a modified RaD scout AC, with its specifications being identical to the players' starting AC unit [[LOADER 4]] except for the head unit being modified by an anonymous party. Armaments includes a shoulder mounted compact duo 3-cell [[missile pod]], [[shoulder cannon|shoulder grenade cannon]] '[[songbirds (armored core)|Songbirds]]', assault rifle 'Scudder' and the devastating melee weapon 'Ashmead' [[pile bunker]].

Nightfall is piloted by the independent mercenary [[raven (armored core vi)|Raven]].

title: sotheby
body:
[b]Sotheby[/b] is a female Arcanist in [[Reverse:1999]].

Originally from the 1920s, Sotheby is a wealthy young lady that specializes in potion making. She is very curious and knowledgeable, but lacks common sense. She has a butler called [[Mr. Karson]]. After meeting [[Sonetto (Reverse:1999)|Sonetto]], she agreed to help her and [[Vertin (Reverse:1999)|]] in escaping the enemy and curing mass hallucinations caused by the impending "Storm". After being rescued from the "Storm", she joined Vertin's group.

Sotheby is voiced by Harriet Kershaw in English and [[Itou Miku]] in Japanese.

title: kimi_no_koto_ga_dai_dai_dai_dai_daisuki_na_100-nin_no_kanojo
body:
[i]Kimi no koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo[/i] ([i]The 100 Girlfriends Who Really, Really, Really, Really, Really Love You[/i]) is a harem romantic comedy manga written by Rikito Nakamura and illustrated by [[Nozawa Yukiko]]. It began serialization on December 26, 2019.

It follows high school student [[Aijou Rentarou]], who in his lifetime fell in love and confessed to exactly 100 girls, only to be rejected by all of them. While praying in a shrine, Rentarou is approached by the God of Love, who reveals that he, due to an error, is destined to have 100 soulmates. However, he also tells Rentarou that if he does not return the feelings of any of his soulmates, they will suffer an accident and die. Not wanting this to happen, Rentarou is determined not to let any of his soulmates die as he meets and dates them all at the same time.

title: harukado_yua
body:
Female main character of [[Yoshibari Aubade]]. 

She is a second year student of senior high school. Yua belongs to the Rhythmic Gymnastics Club of the private Sakakigahara Academy and is one of the "Seven Deadly Sins" in that school, representing "Lust".
Often a victim of [[ryona]] and or [[humiliation]] by her enemies/rivals.

She has been close friends with Haruomi since childhood, but due to a past incident, they limit their closeness to within the home.
After being bitten by a newly transformed vampire Haruomi, she became a failed blood relative, a zombie, and is bound with ropes to suppress her outbursts.

In the sequel novel of [[Yoshibari Aubade]] called "Yoshibari Extra", Yua adopts the identity of the justice heroine "Muse Mask" as part of an undercover mission, wearing an extremely [[revealing clothes|revealing]] and obscene costume. This costume is heavily inspired by [[kekkou_kamen|Kekkou Kamen]], due to its excessive exposure and especially the full head [[mask]].

She also makes an appearance in [[Goddess_defeat:_reincarnation_valanowas|Goddess Defeat: Reincarnation Valanowas]] [女神敗北 転生のヴァラノワ] as a supporting character, having an adult appearance and assuming the role of the goddess Venus.

Yua has [[purple_eyes|purple]]/[[pink eyes]], [[large_breasts|large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]], [[pink_hair|pink]] [[hime_cut|hime cut]] hair, sometimes styled with a [[side_ponytail|side ponytail]] or a [[double_bun|double bun]].

title: help:artists
body:
The "artist library":[/artists] is a specialized database on Danbooru that serves both as a resource for artist homepages, and also as a way to determine the artist of an upload by parsing the URL it came from.

Making an artist entry can be a bit of a tricky endeavor, so this wiki should explain how to go about it.

h4. What are artists?

An artist in Danbooru represents the person who created a piece of art. Danbooru's artist database tracks extra information about artists, including the websites they use and alternate names they're known under.

h4. How do artist entries differ from tags?

For starters, artist entries list all websites or artist profiles that are associated with the artist. Danbooru uses these URLs to automatically identify the artist tag for new uploads, so it's very important to include this information.

Artists can also have multiple "other" names associated with them. Typically this includes the artist's Japanese name. Notes allow one to list other extraneous details.

Artist entries are also used to organize artists that are part of doujin circles. A circle is represented as an artist entry that has multiple group members.

Artist entries do not have to have an associated tag to exist, nor does an artist tag have to have an artist entry when it is made, but it is recommend to make an artist entry for the artist tag as soon as possible, as to ensure that a given artist's work is concentrated in one entry and one tag specifically.

h4. How to find an artist's name

On most art sites, the artist's name should be prominently displayed somewhere on their profile or alongside the post the art comes from. For smaller sites like an artist's home page or blog, information usually come in "about", "profile", "info", "link", "プロファイル", "インフォ", "アバウト", or "管理人" page. The artist's name may appear after "PN", "HN", "管理人", "名前", etc. Their circle or site name may appear after "サイト名" or "HP".

Many Japanese artists will give their name in kanji, which may make it difficult to romanize. Sites like "Tangorin":[http://tangorin.com/names/] can offer assistance with this. If there are multiple readings given, try to see if there is a connection between one of them and the artist's pixiv or Twitter username, site name or link, or email address. If you can't figure it out, you can ask in topic #8199 and someone will be able to offer you help.

If the artist's name is in kana, you can romanize their name yourself using the tables on Wikipedia for "hiragana":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiragana] or "katakana":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katakana]. [[howto:romanize]] contains Danbooru's guidelines on romanization.

If the tag name you want to use already exists, you must qualify it with the artist's group name or handle from a site.

h4. How do I search for artists?

Start at the "index":/artists. In addition to browsing through the entire artist list, you can also search for artist by name or by URL.

By default, Danbooru will search across names, other names, and group names using exact string matching. You can do wildcard searching with "*". For example, searching for "bol*" will return any artist whose name starts with "bol".

If you only want to search the name field, prefix your query with [i]name:[/i] like [i]name:john.[/i] [i]group:[/i] and [i]other:[/i] work similarly.

Suppose you know the artist's homepage, but can't figure out their name. Simply search for the URL (beginning with http) and Danbooru will return any associated artists.

h4. Are artists tied to tags?

No. If you create an artist-typed tag, a corresponding artist is not automatically created. If you create an artist but no corresponding tag, searching for posts by that artist won't return any results.

You can think of the artist database as separate from the tags database.

This is an intentional design decision. By keeping the two separated, users have far more freedom when it comes to creating aliases, groups, and edits.

h4. When I search for a URL, I get a bunch of unrelated results. What's going on?

Short answer: this is just a side-effect of the way Danbooru searches URLs. Multiple results typically mean Danbooru couldn't find the artist.

Long answer: when you're searching for a URL, typically it's a URL to an image on the artist's site. If this is a new image, querying this will obviously return no results.

So what Danbooru does is progressively chop off directories from the URL. http://site.com/a/b/c.jpg becomes http://site.com/a/b becomes http://site.com/a becomes http://site.com. It keeps doing this until a match is found. Danbooru does this more than once because there are cases where the URL is nested by date, like in http://site.com/2007/06/05/image.jpg. Usually this algorithm works very well, provided the artist has an entry in the database.

If they do not, then the algorithm is probably going to cut the URL down to just the domain, e.g. http://geocities.co.jp. When this happens, you'll sometimes get every artist hosted on that domain.

Why not just dump all the results if you get more than one? Well, there are a few cases when multiple artists validly map to the same domain. Usually the domain is just being used to host files or something.

h4. Is there an API?

Yes. The artist controller uses the same interface as the rest of Danbooru. See the [[help:api|API documentation]] for details.

h4. How to make an artist entry

Ideally this should be done before you tag and post the art, as creating an artist entry will automatically create an associated artist tag and allows automatically fetching the artist from a source post. 

To create an entry, you can either go to the "new artist page":[/artists/new] under the Artists tab at the top of the page, or from the upload page (The page where you're prompted to tag before clicking "Post") click the "create new artist" link under the Source tab. Using the link from the upload page will automatically populate the artist entry with an artist name, other names, and URLs, if the site is supported by Danbooru. The automatically populated artist name may not be ideal, so you are free to change it to a better name as determined by the previous section.

From here, you'll see four fields. 
* [b]Name[/b] is self-explanatory.
* [b]Other Names[/b] are for any miscellaneous names or identities the artist has, separated by spaces. These are generally what you should add in this field:

** Names in kanji
** Names in kana
** Site name
** Circle name
** Pixiv nickname (Found under Pixiv avatar)
** Pixiv username (Found in the Pixiv stacc feed URL)
** Twitter name
** Usernames or handles from any other site

* [b]Group[/b] is usually the circle name. Only one group name is supported, as commas and spaces are considered part of the name. Unlike tag names, the group name supports any characters and thus you should use the original spelling and stylization of the name, including CJK characters, asterisks, and capitalization.

* The [b]URLs[/b] field is a list of URLs associated with the artist, like their home page, their blog, and any servers that store the artist's images. Certain sites like Twitter, Patreon, or Fanbox have URLs that use displaynames instead of UIDs- If you are able to obtain the UID URLs, be sure to add them as well. Most UID URLs can be obtained by attempting to create a new artist via a post uploaded (But not posted) with no recognized artist associated with the source. Separate URLs with newlines or spaces.

If you've created a general (blue) tag by mistake, you have to change it to an artist tag before Danbooru will allow you to make an artist entry with that name. To do that, you can simply prefix the tag name with [code]art:[/code] or [code]artist:[/code] from the tag edit field on the post it's tagged on, or by finding it on the "tags listing":[/tags], clicking the triplet dot dropdown menu and clicking "Edit". Note that you should not do this for existing tags, only ones you have created as the wrong category by mistake.

h4. Editing artist entries

If you want to supply additional URLs, Other names, or update the Group name- You can do so from the "/posts/":[/posts?tags=danboorubot] page, clicking "Artist" next to "Posts", and clicking "Edit artist", or by accessing the entry from "/artists/":[/artists/532525] and clicking "Edit" under the sub-tabs (Or "Edit artist" below the list of URLs).
[b]Do not remove dead URLs.[/b] See topic #8048 for the many reasons why you should leave them alone. Instead, prefix the URL with a - to mark it as dead.
If you think the presently assigned name is unsuitable, consider going to the "Artist alias request thread":[/forum_topics/7713] and submitting an alias request. You can also manually edit the name of the artist entry under the Name field, [b]but it is preferred to alias[/b], as this will simultaneously update all tagged posts to the new name.

h4. Wikis

A wiki can exist for an artist, but must be created from "the new Wiki page":[/wiki_pages/new]. This is typically only reserved for important details such as requests not to merge with any alt artist entries, or if the entry is for a commissioner/reposter of some kind. Wikis for artists should not contain any of the URLs associated, to avoid any redundancy.

h4. See also

* "Table of Contents":[/help/toc]
* Using Pixiv: [[howto:pixiv]]

body: A heavy mobile artillery platform developed by BAWS (Belius Applied Weapon Systems) and used by the Rubicon Liberation Front in the game [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. HA-T-102 JUGGERNAUT Fitted with a wide array of frontal firing [[cannon]]s, [[autocannon]]s and [[gatling gun|gatling cannons]] of various calibre, heavily armed and armored from the front, relies on a large tank-like chassis with a pair of [[caterpillar tracks]] and large back mounted [[thrusters]] for mobility.

title: shadow_the_hedgehog
body:
One of [[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s rivals who first appears in [i][[Sonic Adventure 2]][/i]. Also known as "The Ultimate Life Form". He is a black hedgehog who was created by [[Gerald Robotnik]] 50 years prior and befriends [[Maria Robotnik]].

Shadow has a distant, at times borderline edgy personality due to his past, but has gained independence from it and will not tolerate wrongdoings against those he cares for. He wears hover shoes which help grant him the same level of speed as his rival Sonic, and has an immensely high rate of power increase when dispersing the inhibitor rings on both wrists and ankles.

His depiction in [[Shadow the Hedgehog (game)|the self-titled spin-off]] which has him wielding an actual firearms has solidified him as the archetypical "edgy" character within the series and outside of the community.

He is [[voice actor|voiced]] by [[Yusa Kouji|Yusa Kōji]] in the Japanese version, and David Humphrey, Jason Griffith, and Kirk Thornton in English titles. In the live action [[Sonic The Hedgehog 3 (movie)|]] movie, Shadow is voiced by [[Keanu Reeves]].

h4. See also

* [[Super Shadow]]
* [[Doom Morph]]
* [[Terios (sonic)|]] (Beta Design)
* [[Lancelot (sonic)|]]
other_names: シャドウ・ザ・ヘッジホッグ

title: shizukou
body:
Former British [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber]]. "Graduated on February 29, 2024.":[https://twitter.com/Shizukougames/status/1753510911581856075]

h4. Appearance

Shizukou's original design and it's alternate costumes were illustrated by [[Mint (psmin30)]]. Her base design (post #5905014) is a short, [[flat chest]]ed girl with [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|]] [[purple hair]] styled with [[double bun]]s. In her original outfit she wears a [[white dress]] with a [[black bow]] under a [[black jacket]], and [[black shoes]], as well as a [[controller hair ornament]].

Her second outfit (post #5905044) is a summer-themed outfit consisting of a [[blue kimono]] with an [[obi]]. In this appearance she still has short hair, but it is worn in a [[one side up]] style, with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|bow]], [[red flower]] and [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower]]s, and a [[hairclip]].

Her third outfit (post #4598450) is a regal outfit consisting of a [[white dress]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[yellow belt]], a [[fur-trimmed cape|fur-trimmed]] [[black cape]], [[heart earrings]], and a [[mini crown]]. In this appearance she has [[long hair]] with a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow|bow]] worn in a [[one side up]] style.

In 2022, she rebranded with a fully redesigned model illustrated by [[k pring]]. This design (post #5888288) is themed after a Portuguese man-o-war and is a [[large breasts|large breasted]] woman with [[purple eyes]], [[tentacles]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] ([[colored inner hair|colored]] [[blue hair|blue]] on the underside) worn either [[straight hair|straight]] or in [[two side up]]. Her outfit is a set of [[revealing clothes]] comprised of a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with a [[navel cutout]], [[puffy long sleeves|puffy]] [[detached sleeves]], and [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]]. The rebrand was short-lived and she ultimately returned to her original design in 2023.

h4. External links

title: kinomoto_sakura_(fairy)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 12 when she captures the [[Time (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[yellow skirt]] over [[yellow bloomers]], [[yellow scrunchie]]s on her neck, arms and wrists, [[white shoes]] and [[green wings|green]] [[fairy wings]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(dream_sakura)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episodes 45 and 46 when she [spoiler]has to fight against [[Yue (cardcaptor sakura)|]] to pass the Final Judgment so she can become the new mistress of the Clow Cards.[/spoiler]

She wears a [[pink hat]] with a yellow stripe at the top, a [[pink capelet]] over a [[pink cape]], a [[white leotard]] with long sleeves, [[white gloves]], [[yellow shorts|yellow puffy shorts]], [[blue thighhighs]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(astral_sakura)
body:
The costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the third opening of the 90s anime, [i]Platinum[/i]. She also wears it in the crossover game [[Magical Battle Arena]]. Take care not to confuse this outfit with her [[kinomoto sakura (princess costume)|Princess costume]] from the second movie.

It is a [[white dress|white]] [[frilled dress]], [[layered dress|layered]] over a [[pink dress]], with [[white wings]], a [[frilled choker|frilled]] [[pink choker|pink]] [[star choker]], [[white shoes]], and a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] on her left leg

title: albion_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the aircraft carrier HMS [i]Albion[/i] (R07). Character design by [[Ng Jie]], voiced by Shiraki Nao. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[fairy wings]] and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[midriff]] [[revealing clothes|revealing dress]] that [[bare shoulders|exposes her shoulders]], a white [[collar]] piece with a [[halterneck]], gold [[hair ornament]], large [[fairy wings]], [[white skirt]], long purple straps from the skirt, and [[barefoot|only wearing ankle ornaments]] for footwear. She uses a [[bow (weapon)|]] much like her sister and the US carrier girls, patterned off her real-life hull and masts.

Like her sister, she refers to all the other carrier girls as her [i]senpai[/i] (officially translated as "Elders") on account of the fact that they were, in real life, laid down in 1944 and commissioned [b]in 1953/1954[/b], well after the Second World War had ended.
