title: ultimate_madoka
body:
[[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character. An alternate persona of [[Kaname Madoka]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] [[pink hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], tied into [[two side up]] with [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow|bows]]. She also has [[pink wings|pink]] [[wings]].

She wears a [[white choker|white]] [[choker]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket|bolero]] with [[pink gemstone]]s and [[short sleeves|short]], [[wide sleeves|wide]], [[layered sleeves]]; [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], a [[high-low dress|high-low]], [[layered dress|layered]], [[white dress|white]] [[dress]] with a [[low neckline]], [[frilled dress|frills]] and a [[space print]] on the [[two-sided fabric|inner side]], along with [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[thighhighs]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[winged footwear|winged]] [[pumps]].

Note that official materials always have edges of hair out of screen, or hidden behind her if that is not an option.

[spoiler]It is the form Madoka takes in the final episode of the anime, after wishing to get rid of [[witch_(madoka_magica)|Witches]] entirely and unleashing the full power of her magic potential accumulated over multiple timelines to become an incredibly powerful, goddess-like being.[/spoiler]
Affectionately nicknamed "Madokami" or "Godoka" by fans.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6818924

title: multiple_theme_colors
body:
When two or more characters have their theme colors represented in a single image. You want to see an even distribution of each theme color, and you also want to see multiple elements using each color, not just the characters themselves. This can include the background colors, separately colored auras, flowers or petals, weapons, text, symbols, or anything else relevant.

title: azure_striker_gunvolt_1
body:
A 2014 side-scrolling video game by Inti Creates for the [[Nintendo 3DS]] eShop.

The game takes place in a distant future where those born with psychic powers known as "Adapts" (EN) / "Seventh" (JP) are feared and oppressed on a regular basis by those without. A major world-wide conglomerate known as the Sumeragi Group tasked themselves into bringing peace to Adapts under their "Psychic Protection" program, but unbeknownst to the world, their so-called plan for peace turned out to be what amounts to concentration camps where a series of cruel and inhumane experiments are performed on Adapts under their program. A resistance group known as QUILL (EN) / FEATHER (JP) however surfaced in attempt to stop their atrocities. One of their newest members, a 14-year-old Adapt boy known only by his codename, "[[Gunvolt]]", who also possesses the titular "Azure Striker" (EN) / "Armed Blue" (JP) septima, the ability to control electricity and lightning. During one mission where Gunvolt is tasked to stop Sumeragi's plans to steal the cyber diva [[Lumen (gunvolt)|]] (EN) / Morpho (JP) and her septima of "The Muse" to control Adapts across the world then destroy her, Gunvolt however he discovers that the cyber diva was not a computer programmed idol, but rather the manifestation of a young girl's septimal powers named [[Joule (gunvolt)|]] (EN) / Cyan (JP). Not wishing to see Joule suffer through the same kind of oppression he went through, Gunvolt boldly went against his orders and rescues her from her captors.

h4. Characters

h5. Main characters

* [[Gunvolt]]
* [[Joule (gunvolt)|Cyan (JP) / Joule (EN)]]

title: ino_(xenoblade)
body: DLC Hero in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 3]]. She is an Artificial Blade in [[android|the same sense]] as [[Poppi (Xenoblade)|]] in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]], built by a hitherto unknown Nopon engineer named Oosoo as a champion for the Nopon of Aionios. Upon meeting the party, she declares [[Noah (Xenoblade)|Noah]] to be her Driver and calls him "Masterpon" to the party's confusion and bewilderment.

title: jirass
body:
A [[dinosaur]]-like [[kaiju]] from [[Ultraman (1st series)|]]. Like [[Gomess]] before it, it resembles [[Godzilla]], in terms of design as well as having the same suit actor, Nakajima Haruo.

While Jirass has reappeared more recently, due to how little he differs from Godzilla (with the suit being a combination of MosuGoji's body with DaisensoGoji's head, with an added frill), Gomess is often utilized instead if the intent is to make Godzilla references to avoid running afoul of Toei's copyright.

title: gomess
body:
A [[dinosaur]]-like [[kaiju]] from [[Ultra Q|]], and the very first kaiju to appear in the [[Ultra Series]]. Like [[Jirass]] after it, it resembles [[Godzilla]], in terms of design as well as having the same suit actor, Nakajima Haruo.

After being absent for decades, Gomess returned in [[Ultra Galaxy Mega Dai-Kaijuu Battle]] and became a reoccuring kaiju in the New Generation era. As a result, however, Gomess' size was boosted from its original 10 meters as to compete, with the size-increased versions receiving names to distinguish from the original. It is often used to make Godzilla references.

title: psylocke
body:
An [[X-Men]] character with the powers of [[telepathy]] and [[telekinesis]].

The first Psylocke was Elizabeth "Betsy" Braddock, a British woman who was the twin sister of Brian Braddock, aka [[Captain Britain]]. When Betsy was captured by the Mandarin, she ended switching bodies with a Japanese ninja mutant named Kwannon, which Betsy continue to use her codename Psylocke in her new Japanese body over 29 years. Eventually both Betsy and Kwannon switch back to their original bodies with Betsy becoming the new Captain Britain while Kwannon becomes the second Psylocke.

A third Psylocke was introduced in Marvel's 2021 Demon Days mini comic series set in a Marvel universe that merged with Japanese mythology. This version of Psylocke is named [[Psylocke (sai)|Sai]], a wandering [[Samurai]] who hunts [[traditional youkai|Yokai]] with her psionic powers. The Psylocke Sai would later appear in the video game [[Marvel Rivals]].

As a result of her confusing backstory, Psylocke is either portrayed as British, Japanese or British Asian in other media.

In film, she appears in [[X-Men: The Last Stand]] and [[X-Men: Apocalypse]] in the [[X-Men film series]]. In videogames, she appears in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series and in [[Marvel Rivals]].

h4. Appearance

title: suzumiya_haruhi_no_shoushitsu
body:
[i]The Disappearance of Haruhi Suzumiya[/i] is the fourth volume in the [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]] light novel series. It was adapted into a film in February 2010.

The manga [[Nagato Yuki-chan no Shoushitsu]], with art by [[Puyo (puyotopia)|]], is a spin-off based on the setting of this volume.

title: suzumiya_haruhi
body:
Titular main character of [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]]. A spunky, demanding teenage girl who loves mysteries and paranormal phenomena. 

[spoiler]Unbeknowst to Haruhi, she has the ability to alter the very fabric of reality itself to get whatever she wished for, including an encounter with [[Nagato Yuki|an alien]], a [[Asahina Mikuru|time traveller]], and an [[Koizumi Itsuki|esper]] who were sent to investigate her.[/spoiler]

She has [[brown eyes]] and a [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair|brown]] [[bob cut]], which she wears with a [[orange hairband]]. Her most common outfit is a blue [[serafuku]] with a [[red ribbon]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

She is voiced by [[Hirano Aya]] in Japanese and [[Wendee Lee]] in English.

body:

body:
A [[cone (geometry)|]]-shaped marker, usually red and white in color, placed on a [[road]] to temporarily redirect [[traffic]] away from an area, usually from [[construction]] projects or traffic [[accident]]s. 

Also known as a safety cone or road cone.

body:

title: jersey_barrier
body:
A modular [[traffic barrier]] used to separate lanes of [[traffic]], made of plastic or concrete. Plastic ones can be filled with [[water]] for additional weight. It is named after the state of New Jersey which first started using the barriers as separators between lanes of a highway in the 1950s.

title: traffic_barrel
body:
A plastic [[barrel]], usually orange or yellow in color, used as a [[traffic barrier]] to channel traffic away or around obstacles and construction sites. Essentially a larger version of the [[traffic cone]]. For night work, there may be small flashing lights attached to the top.

Also known as a traffic drum, construction barrel, or construction drum.

title: gorget
body:
An [[armor|armored]] collar, originally used to protect the throat. Sometimes strapped directly to the [[breastplate]].

After the Middle Ages, particularly in the 18th century, the gorget had become an ornamental signifier of rank for officers in many European armies, but this too largely fell out of favor by the mid-19th century.

title: mang_(project_moon)
body:
A power enhancement in [[Project Moon]] that visually manifests as a ring of light around the enhanced subject.
First introduced in [[Leviathan (project moon)|]].

It is fueled by Shin, an energy gained by clearing one's mind and tapping into their deepest emotion, similar to but not quite like [[E.G.O (project moon)|]].

[spoiler] [[Bari (project Moon)|]] appears to use an ability similar to Mang in her duel against [[La_manchaland's Don Quixote (Project Moon)|Don Quixote]], but it is currently unconfirmed if it is Mang or another ability entirely.

title: youtube_creator_award
body:
[b]YouTube Creator Awards[/b] are a series of [[play button]]-plaques awarded by [[YouTube]] in recognition of popular channels and content creators. They are based on subscriber count, however not every channel which reaches the required level receives one, as YouTube grants them at its own discretion.

The current awards and their associated subscriber counts are:
* [b][[Silver Creator Award]][/b] - [u]100,000 Subscribers[/u]
** - Nickel alloy
* [b][[Gold Creator Award]][/b] - [u]One Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Gold-plated brass. This is the award most commonly depicted.
* [b]Diamond Creator Award[/b] - [u]Ten Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Silver-plated metal inset with colorless crystal glass in the shape of a play button triangle.
* [b]Custom[/b] (a.k.a. [b]Ruby[/b]) [b]Creator Award[/b] - [u]50 Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Design varies according to receipient.
** - 90 recipients as of July 2025.
* [b]Red Diamond Creator Award[/b] - [u]100 Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Dark glass or metal with red Baccarat crystal (made of gold, barium oxide, and sand) in the shape of a play button triangle.
** - Only 14 recipients as of July 2025: [[PewDiePie]], "T-Series":https://www.youtube.com/user/tseries, "Cocomelon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cocomelon, "Sony Entertainment Television India":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sony_Entertainment_Television, [[MrBeast]], "Kids Diana Show":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kids_Diana_Show], "Like Nastya":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Like_Nastya], "Vlad and Niki":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vlad_and_Niki], "Zee Music Company":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zee_Music_Company], [[WWE]], "Goldmines":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goldmines], "Stokes Twins":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stokes_Twins], "Sony SAB":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sony_SAB], and "KIMPRO":[https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/%EA%B9%80%ED%94%84%EB%A1%9C].

h4. External links

* "Creator Awards for Subscriber Milestones - YouTube Creators":[https://www.youtube.com/creators/how-things-work/programs-initiatives/awards/]

title: lamar_roasts_franklin_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a cutscene from [[Grand Theft Auto V]] featuring [[Franklin Clinton]] and [[Lamar Davis]]. It takes place in the mission [i]"Franklin and Lamar":[https://gta.fandom.com/wiki/Franklin_and_Lamar][/i] where Lamar retorts back to Franklin for not hanging out with him after finishing a repossession job. 

[quote]
Lamar: "Wassup, can a loc come up in your crib?"

Franklin: "Man, fuck you. I'll see you at work."

Lamar: "Ah, nigga don't hate me 'cause I'm beautiful nigga. Maybe if you got rid of that old yee-yee ass haircut you got you'd get some bitches on your dick. Oh, better yet, maybe Tanisha'll call your dog-ass if she ever stops fuckin' with that brain surgeon or lawyer she fucking with. [b]Nigga...[/b]

Franklin: "...What?"
[/quote]

The scene went viral after some Japanese virtual youtubers unknowingly repeated Lamar's "nigga" without knowing its actual meaning, most notably [[Sakura Miko]] from [[Hololive]].

The meme later regained resurgence due to a series of videos featuring various other characters insulting Frankin's "yee-yee ass haircut" through mods and efforts of voice acting.

The scene was later officially referenced of [i]The Contract[/i] DLC in [i]GTA Online[/i], though the word [i]nigga[/i] is sarcastically changed into [i]my politically incorrect racial epithets[/i] in response to the word's sensitive usage.

The meme is taken even one step further with the actual voice actors (Shawn "Solo" Fonteno and Gerald "Slink" Johnson) recreating it in real life.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Lamar Roasts Franklin":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/lamar-roasts-franklin-yee-yee-ass-haircut]

title: cibo
body:
[[Blame!]] character. Head scientist of the Bio-Electric Corporation in the Capitol.

Originally a human, she transfers her mind into several different bodies over the course of the manga, so she could be considered a [[cyborg]]. She has [[white hair|white]] or [[silver hair]], [[pale skin]] and wears a black [[bodysuit]]. A skilled hacker proficient with technology, machines, tools and first aid procedures. She is often seen carrying pieces of equipment interconnected by [[cable|cables]].

She is taller than [[Killy]] and many other characters (this is due to the isolation that human settlements experience in the Megastructure) so consider using [[height difference]].

title: sanakan
body: Sanakan (サナカン, officially 'Sana-Kan) is a character from [[BLAME!]] who first appears as a short young girl with [[black hair]]. She later appears as a taller [[android]] figure with [[short hair|short]] black hair, [[red eyes]], and an [[arm cannon]].

title: reizei_mako
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Driver of Team [[Anglerfish]] in a [[Panzer IV]] on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anglerfish

h6. Original Anime

Is a genius at the top of her class.  But, due to her habitual tardiness in the morning she has insufficient credits, and so she is pursuing Tankery in exchange for credits.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1283975)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Belongs to the Ooarai Girls tankery team.  Team Anglerfish's driver. Has excellent grades, but due to low blood pressure is weak in the mornings. With her genius she was able to master the controls with high degree of maneuverability just by reading the manual, and manipulates the Panzer IV freely according to Miho's intent. A childhood friend of Saori, she loves eating desserts and going to bed.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love

Driver for Team Anglerfish. A gifted girl with top marks in her grade, and her memory and reading comprehension are unmatched. Has a great weakness for heights and getting up early, her best friend is the night when everyone else is asleep. That's why, no matter how scorching the temperature is, when the sun is out her eyelids naturally close...zzz.

[tn]Source: "[4]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: isuzu_hana
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Gunner of Team [[Anglerfish]] in a [[Panzer IV]] on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Voiced by [[Ozaki Mami]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anglerfish

h6. Original Anime

She is a genuine Ojou-sama, born into a family of flower arrangers, but feeling dissatisfied with her own flower arrangements, she chose to participate in tankery.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1283974)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Belongs to the Ooarai Girls tankery team.  Team Anglerfish's gunner.  The new Student Council President.  Although the gentle daughter of a respectable flower-arranging family, she is participating in tankery in order to add vigor to her flower arrangements.  The strength of her heart being authentic, she demonstrates a high ability as a gunner with the concentration she cultivated in flower arranging.  Acts the calm straight man to Saori that tends to daydream.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love

Gunner for Team Anglerfish, she is known for her politeness and gentle demeanor. Perhaps due to her upbringing as the daughter of a head of a flower arrangement school, she actually has a longing for extraordinary events. She has been friends with Saori since middle school, and seems to be a bit concerned about her passionate love love.

[tn]Source: "[4]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: dandelion_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character in [[Girls' Frontline]].

[spoiler]Originally an OGAS born within [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]'s Neural Cloud, under the influence of the Parapluie virus. Upon the removal of her neural cloud's seals, her OGAS would access a new stage of consciousness and realize it was an entity distinct from M4, yet living in her mind. Believing in the perfection of [[Elisa (girls' frontline)|]]'s Neural Cloud, and wishing to merge with her OGAS as to achieve the perfected form of OGAS, it would try to convince M4 to pursue its interests, believing it to be of benefit to the both of them (referring to M4 as [[Lunasia (girls' frontline)|]] all the while).

After several story developments, during which time it understood it could also access the minds of [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s, during the events of Shattered Connexion, it would assimilate the Isomers of Tallinn, taking over the body of the [[Isomer Hivemind (girls' Frontline)|former Nimogen]] in the process. The assimilation process would mellow out its wishes, and prompt her to finally side with M4. With a physical body now, she would be dubbed "Dandelion" during Chapter 12.
[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #3796865: Girls' Frontline
* !post #9038302: [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Dandelion":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Dandelion]

title: akiyama_yukari
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Loader of Team [[Anglerfish]] in a [[Panzer IV]] on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Voiced by [[Nakagami Ikumi]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anglerfish

h6. Original Anime

Loves nothing more than tanks! She uses that knowledge to help the team. In admiration of Miho she joined the team.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1283986)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Belongs to the Ooarai Girls tankery team.  Team Anglerfish's loader.  The new Student Council Vice-President. The daughter of a family that runs a barber shop on the Ooarai school ship, she has liked tanks ever since she was little. In addition to her ability as a loader, she contributes to the team with her rich knowledge on tanks plus the dedication to scout out other teams by herself. She respects Miho from the bottom of her heart.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love!

Loader for Team Anglerfish. A tank enthusiast who can be called the embodiment of tankery. Her catchphrase is, "Yahoo~! This is awesome~!". With a highly valued vigor, she is given the role of shock trooper. Her trademark fluffy hair provides great defensive power!?

[tn]Source: "[4]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

title: mo_(girls'_frontline_2)
body:
A blue-eyed floating [[Dinergate (girls' frontline)|]] from [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], a part of the [[Elmo (vehicle)|]] and part of the main menu. When possessed by [[Dandelion (girls' frontline)|]], its blue eye turns grey.

In promotional media, she receives a personified projection and shares news on upcoming content. In Chinese, she's known as Little Mo, in English, she's simply Mo, while in Japanese, she's Elmon. In Korea, she doesn't receive a personified projection and is instead depicted with a chibi of the actual Dinergate, referred to initially as 'Dinergate-ssi' (디너게이트 씨) before being dubbed 'Speaki' (스피키).

h4. Appearance

title: takebe_saori
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Radio Operator of Team [[Anglerfish]] in a [[Panzer IV]] on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Her [[catchphrase]] is やだもー (Yada mo~, [tn]Good grief~[/tn]).

Voiced by [[Kayano Ai]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anglerfish

h6. Original Anime

She idolizes the concept of romance and connects everything in the world to it in her mind. She thought she would be popular if she took tankery, however ...

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1283979)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Belongs to the Ooarai Girls tankery team.  Team Anglerfish's radio operator.  The new Student Council Public Relations officer.  Has dreams of yearning for love, however she adores the underclassmen and takes care of them with good cooking.  Contributes to the team through high communication skills such as being good at fast texting and also by acquiring an amateur radio license.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love

Radio Operator for Team Anglerfish. She is interested in romance, so much so that she chose tankery as she believed the words, "if you study tankery, you'll be popular with the boys". Having won the national tournament, she is looking forward to the day when she receives a flood of fan mail.

[tn]Source: "[4]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: nishizumi_miho
body:
The main protagonist of the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander and leader of Team Anglerfish in a [[Panzer IV]], and overall commander for "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anglerfish

h6. Original Anime

She was born into the distinguished family of the Nishizumi-style of Tankery, but she changed schools to Ooarai Girls Academy intending to run away from Tankery.  However, perplexingly enough, she was extorted into joining Tankery by the student council.  A junior in high school that considers her friends feelings more than anything else.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1283978)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Overall commander for the Ooarai Girls tankery team, and boards the Panzer IV Ausf.H (originally Ausf.D) as the tank commander.  Second daughter of the Nishizumi family which heads the Nishizumi-style of tankery.  Following the 63rd National Tankery Tournament, she led the team to victory against the Selection University team and secured the existence of the school.  Has a warm personality, but when faced with a problem, is able to put together flexible tactics that go beyond the limits of the Nishizumi-style.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love

A girl transferring from Kuromorimine Girls Academy, her family is of the Nishizumi Style, a prestigious school of tankery. As commander of Team Anglerfish, she helped contribute to the victory of Ooarai Girls in the national tournament. Although she is a calm girl who is considerate of those around her, she also has a strong core. This can be seen from the fact that she loves the bear mascot "Boko", even though those around her do not understand.

[tn]Source: "[4]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: z35_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German destroyer Z35. Character design by [[Sakura Koharu]], voiced by [[Oohashi Ayaka]].

In-game, she bears a striking similarity to [[Shimamura Uzuki]] (even sharing the same voice actress) due to similar attributes like [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] tied [[two side up]], [[blue eyes]], and a cheerful personality. She differs from Uzuki in that she wears the typical Ironblood destroyer [[rigging]] of two 12.7 cm single gun mounts and 53.3 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]], held together by a bridge [[rigging]] to her back. She also wears a black [[beret]], a [[double-breasted]] grey top with [[sailor collar]], [[black skirt]] with [[Iron Cross]] straps, [[pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]].

title: howe_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the battleship HMS [i]Howe[/i] (32). Character design by [[Snow Is]], voiced by [[Ichimichi Mao]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[gradient hair]] that is mostly [[blonde hair|blonde]] in color with an [[ahoge]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[red dress]], [[fur collar]], a two-tone [[sash]] with her [[ship's badge]] attached to it, [[pantyhose]], and white [[knee boots]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of two portions to each side, each with a single 35.6 cm quad gun mount and a funnel with two searchlights but her left carries a third 35.6 cm twin gun mount while her right carries two 13.3 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]].

title: enterprise_(hms)_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Enterprise[/i] (D52). Character design by [[Dsmile]], voiced by [[Fujii Yukiyo]]. 

Not to be confused with the US Navy's [[enterprise_(azur_lane)|USS Enterprise]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], yellowish-[[green eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default (and only) outfit is a [[maid]] attire in common with the Royal Navy's light cruiser theme: [[maid headdress]], [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress]] with [[sleeves past fingers|very long sleeves]], [[detached collar]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[maid apron]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[black shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces held by her back funnel and [[aircraft catapult]] and each containing 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], but her right has two 152 mm single mounts and left has a [[crane (machine)|]] and a prototype twin mount.

h4. Skins

title: lima_(cinderella)_(princess_connect!)
body:
[[Lima (princess connect!)|]]'s [[official alternate costume|official]] cinderella costume in [[Princess Connect!]].

She is a [[llama girl]] who has [[animal ears|llama ears]], a [[tail]], [[brown eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and an [[ahoge]]. She wears a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[white dress|white]] & [[blue dress|blue]] [[strapless dress]] with [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[blue bow|blue]] [[dress bow]], and a [[detached collar]].

title: chloe_(school_festival)_(princess_connect!)
body:
[[Chloe (princess connect!)|]]'s [[official alternate costume|official]] school festival costume in [[Princess Connect!]].

She is an [[elf]] who has [[purple eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] stylized in a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[gym uniform]] consisting of a [[tied shirt|tied]] [[white shirt|white]] [[plaid collar|plaid]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[gym shirt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[gym shorts]], [[green bow|green]] [[plaid bow|plaid]] [[hair bow]], and a [[green jacket|green]] [[jacket around waist]] showing a [[midriff]]. As well as a [[black choker]].

h4. See Also

* "School Festival Chloe":[https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Chloe_(School_Festival)]

title: chloe_(real)_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. [spoiler]Kuroe Hanako (黒江 花子), the "player" of [[Chloe (princess connect!)|]] in the real world.[/spoiler]

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] stylized in a [[side ponytail]] with [[bangs]] and [[sidelocks]]. She usually wears a [[tied shirt|tied]] [[pink shirt]], [[black choker]], [[necklace]], [[short shorts]], [[brown belt]], and an [[open jacket|open]] [[green jacket]]. Her [[school uniform]] is the [[Ourindou Private High School Uniform]].

title: aether_foundation_employee
body:
The Aether Foundation (Japanese: エーテル財団 Aether Foundation) is an organization based in the Alola region whose goal is to cure hurt Pokémon. The organization shelters Pokémon to keep them safe from threats like [[Team Skull]]. Their headquarters is Aether Paradise, an artificial island they constructed.

title: yorktown_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of the US aircraft carrier USS [i]Yorktown[/i] (CV-5). Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Yuuki Kana (voice Actor)|]].

She  has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[jacket]], over her [[white dress]] with a black underlayer, extending to a little over her knees. She has [[black pantyhose]] with bright blue shoes. Her [[rigging]] is composed of a [[flight deck]] with yellow marking and the letters "YKTN" on her right, and island superstructure on her left.

The eagle she is depicted is [[Grim (Azur Lane)|the same]] as [[Enterprise (Azur Lane)|Enterprise's]], to whom Yorktown gave it.

The planes shown with her are an [[F4F Wildcat]] and an [[SBD Dauntless]], the planes she last used in her final battle at Midway.

h4. Appearance
[tn]All skins of the original Yorktown can be used with Yorktown II.[/tn]

title: prinz_heinrich_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the P-class heavy cruiser [i]Prinz Heinrich[/i]. Character design by [[Dishwasher1910]], voiced by [[Nitta Hiyori]]. 

Like other Ironblood ships, Prinz Heinrich has a general red-white-black color theme, with  [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[white hair]] tied into a low braid framing [[red eyes]] and adorned by a black [[hair ribbon]]. Her outfit consists of a [[crop top]] with [[detached sleeves]] that exposes a [[large_breasts|significant amount]] of [[underboob]]. Covering her waist is a black jacket with a red anchor ornament and a [[pleated skirt]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of all her four 283 mm mounts (two triple, two twin) in an animalistic rig that she refers to as "Eisen". An excitable girl prone to air-headedness, Prinz Heinrich often boasts of her strength while having difficulty grasping the necessity of tactical skill. She has also named her rigging "Eisen", and treats it much the same way one would a beloved dog, reflective of one of her in-game skills.

H4. Appearance

* !post #4290542: Default
* !post #4290541: [[Prinz Heinrich (Fireworks And Tapestries) (Azur Lane)|Fireworks and Tapestries]] ([[kimono]])

* !post #6090536:  [[Prinz Heinrich (Secret Boss O' The Underworld?) (Azur Lane)|Secret Boss O' The Underworld?]] ([[sukeban]])

body:

She wears a hairband with long purple ribbons and five stars adorning it, similar to the five stars seen on an SSR Servant's card. She wears another purple ribbon as a bowtie with a star decoration, a purple bikini, fingerless black gloves, a purple beaded bracelet, small black shorts, a white belt, black toeless thighhighs, and purple high heel sandals.

body:
Mikagura Gakuen Kumikyoku (Commonly translated as Mikagura School Suite) is a series of [[Vocaloid]] songs by producer Last Note. with characters designed and illustrated by [[akina422|Akina]], released from 2012 to 2015. The songs spawned a light novel series(by Last Note. and Akina), a manga adaptation(by [[sayuki (sareki sobaya)|Sayuki]]) and an anime adaptation by [[doga kobo|Doga Kobo]] that aired in Spring 2015.

body:

In [[Saber Wars II]], Astarte Origin was a major antagonist, seeking to destroy the [[Servant Universe (fate)|]]. [spoiler]She is the leftover body of the goddess Astarte, after she split her personality between the good and evil halves who became their own Space Ishtars.[/spoiler]

title: penthesilea_(amazones_ceo)_(fate)
body:
[[Penthesilea (fate)|]] in her Amazones CEO outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It's not much different than her Second Ascension attire, except she gains a pair of glasses and a black necktie. In the [[Servant Universe (fate)|]], a dimension completely separate to FGO's, Penthesilea works as the CEO for the intergalactic delivery company Amazones, an obvious parody of [[Amazon (company)|]] due to her being the queen of the Amazons. It's mostly her demeanor that changes rather than her attire, acting more like a professional businesswoman (although she still goes berserk whenever [[Achilles (fate)|]] is mentioned).

The additional glasses and necktie are part of a separate character skin for Penthesilea in-game, which changes some of her voice lines.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9157507

h4. Costumes

title: uno_(game)
body:
Commercial card game developed in 1971 by Merle Robbins from the [[playing card]] game Crazy Eights. It is currently marketed by Mattel.

In the game, players discard cards matching the color or number/symbol of the card on a discard pile. Certain action cards call the next color to play, reverse the direction of play, force the next player to draw a certain number of cards, or forfeit the next player's turn altogether. A player has to shout "Uno" (Spanish/Italian for "one") to warn other players they are down to their last card; a round ends when a player runs out of cards. In older rule sets, points are scored by adding values of the other players' cards and awarded to the player that ran out. For a quicker game, newer rule sets skip scoring and the player who runs out wins the round.

One popular house rule (not an official rule) is to counter a "Draw 2/4" card by playing a similar "Draw 2/4" card, thus "stacking" the number of cards the following player has to draw.

h4. See also:

* [[uno reverse card]]
* [[Draw 25 (meme)]]
* [[Imminent Uno loss (meme)]]
* [[Moero! Card Match UNO]]
* [[Mimukauwa Nice Try (Vocaloid)]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":[http://mattelgames.com/en-us/cards/uno]
* "Official Japanese website":[https://mattel.co.jp/toys/uno/]
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uno_(card_game)]

title: mysterious_ranmaru_x_(fate)
body:
Avenger-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] introduced in the [[GUDAGUDA Ryouma Kiki Ippatsu!]] event. Like [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]], she is from the [[Servant Universe (fate)|]], specifically Planet Ranmaru. She is a version of [[Mori Nagayoshi (fate)|]]'s brother, Mori Ranmaru. She keeps her right eye covered with an [[eyepatch]], hiding a [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[red eyes|red eye]].

Her gender is listed as unknown, and uses her own name (Ranmaru) as a personal pronoun. She states that whether she is a boy or a girl depends on "her Ranmanium growth cycles".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Mika Pikazo]] 
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Machiko]]

title: toned_female
body:
A female character with an athletic body while not being overly [[muscular]]. Toned females typically have visible [[abs]] and some muscle definition, without being bulky like a bodybuilder.

Don't tag [[toned]] characters as [[muscular]]. [[Muscular female]]s are bulkier than [[toned female]]s.

h4. Examples

* !post #2668335
* !post #7469016
* !post #6860060

title: chalk_drawing
body:
A drawing inside the image made from [[chalk]]. Typically on a [[chalkboard]] such as in a [[classroom]] or on the ground in a [[playground]].

Not to be confused with [[chalk (medium)]], which is for [[traditional media]] made from chalk.

h4. See Also


* [[board eraser]]
* [[child's drawing]] 
* [[hopscotch]]

title: toned
body:
A character who has a toned or athletic build, but is not overly [[muscular]].

A [[toned]] body has little fat and may have well developed [[abs]], but the overall visible musculature of the character should look slim or athletic, not buff or bulky. Think track and field, not body building.

Don't tag [[toned]] characters as [[muscular]]. Details like bulkiness of the [[thick arms |arms]], [[thick neck|neck]], [[v-taper|waist]], and [[broad shoulders]] are a good way to distinguish between [[toned]] and [[muscular]] builds.

h4. Examples

title: donkey_kong_bananza
body:
A [[Nintendo Switch 2]] game and the first 3D platformer entry in the [[Donkey Kong (series)|]] series since [[Donkey Kong 64]], released on July 17, 2025.
Notable for being one of the first games, along with [[Mario Kart World]], to feature a redesign for [[Donkey Kong]] that closely resembles his [[Donkey Kong (1981 Game)|arcade]] appearance, also seen in [[The Super Mario Bros. Movie]].

title: angelina_(arknights)
body:
[i]Angelina, Supporter Operator and Messenger of Rhodes Island, would like to provide help with her amazing Originium Arts.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Angelina Ajimu

h4. Profile
[expand]

A transporter responsible for delivering intelligence and special cargo around Siracusa. As an apprentice caster Operator, she now provides logistical support, battlefield assistance, and tactical coordination for Rhodes Island. Likes jewelry, young adult novels, and secretly listening to old music.

Capable of manipulating weight and uses an arcane staff to channel her abilities. Due to her Vulpo characteristics, her motif is based on foxes.

She is voiced by [[Oohashi Ayaka]].

title: mudrock_(arknights)
body:
[i]Mudrock, Sarkaz mercenary, old friend of the fertile soil and stone.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 21[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]163 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]4 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Formerly a part of the Reunion Movement, Mudrock led her team far from Ursus after disagreements with the organization. She had no involvement with Reunion whatsoever during the incidents in Chernobog and Lungmen. Searching for a foothold to establish, Mudrock took her team towards Leithania. After taking in a great number of Leithanien Infected there, Mudrock became a highly esteemed leader, and her team came to be known as the [i]Mudrock Squad[/i].

Despite Mudrock's multiple attempts to avoid conflict with other powers, her side was nevertheless drawn into constant disputes. So as to prevent any further meaningless sacrifice, she headed to Kazdel and after coming into contact with an elite operator named Logos, she departed for Rhodes Island.

She and her squad are antagonists of the side story event [i]Twilight of Wolumonde[/i].

Uses a [[sledgehammer]]-styled [[war hammer]] during combat. Her [[voice actor]] is [[Uchida Maaya]].

h4. Appearance

title: skadi_(arknights)
body:
[i]Skadi, bounty hunter, has come with the tide to drown your enemies.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Unknown[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]166 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]13 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A famous bounty hunter from the Abyssal Hunters. She is very experienced in combat, but her history prior to becoming a bounty hunter is a mystery. In the minds of her fellow bounty hunters and operators, she is a literal walking Catastrophe. She is now an Operator for a Rhodes Island assault team, and also executes solo missions. Her choice of weapon is a huge sword, which she swings like a golf club to attack.

Together with [[Grani_(Arknights)|]], she is the secondary protagonist in the side story [i]Grani and the Knights' Treasure[/i].

Her motif is based on an [[orca]]. Her callsign is derived from the Norse goddess of hunting and winter.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Satou Rina]] (Japanese), Zhang Qi (Chinese), Cristina Vee (English), and Kim Na-yul (Korean). Her art designer is [[alchemaniac]].

title: savage_(arknights)
body:
[i]Savage, Guard Operator of Rim Billiton, has always been thinking of doing something for you and Amiya.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [i][[Arknights]][/i].

Real name: Charlotte

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]RIM Billiton[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]

      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]160 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]4 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former agent of a mining company's security force from Rim Billiton. She uses her Arts to detonate her hammer and cause wide devastation, hence her codename.

She is a kind, cheerful, reliable and friendly operator. She likes playing football and cooking.

She personally knows [[Amiya (arknights)|]] and the [[Doctor (arknights)|]], even before the latter's amnesia.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Ayumi Jukimura (Japanese, former), Sachie Hirai (Japanese, current), Muyaruilin (Chinese), Stephanie Sheh (English), and Lee Bo-hee (Korean). Her original art designer is [[renatus.z|TOKI]], while her new outfit has designed by [[usu (9619usu)|usu]].

title: la_pluma_(arknights)
body:
A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Rafaela Silva

The adopted daughter of Bolívarian militant [[pancho_salas_(arknights)|Pancho Salas]] and [[Tequila (Arknights)|]]'s sister. Tends to be clingy and submissive to whomever she trusts completely, like towards her father and the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]]. Taciturn and seemingly absent-minded, but an extremely capable and laser-focused fighter. She is also a skilled bartender.

Her callsign means [i]The Feather[/i] in Spanish and her motif is based on crows. Wields a scythe in battle.

One of the main characters in the side story [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i].

Her voice actors are [[Kouno Marika]] (Japanese), and Liu Yilei (Chinese). Her art designer is [[LAL!ROLE]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4679398: Elite II

body:
[i]Medic Operator Tuye, a Forte most unlike a Forte.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]

      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former logistical employee of a trading company from Sargon. She joined Rhodes Island to treat the Oripathy that she contracted in a sandstorm during her work.

Despite her engineering qualifications, she displayed outstanding medical knowledge and proficiency in operating relevant tools. Thus she was transferred from the Engineering to the Medical department.

She is socially reclusive, but will prank the operators that she likes. She will get mad if anyone tries to touch the device on her back or the umbrella that she always carries.

Her motif is based on Bactrian [[camel]]s. Her name means "camel" in Kazakh.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Nakano Saima (JP), Z-kun (CN) and Han Chae-eon (KR). Her illustrator is [[aZLing]].

A former experimental test subject from [[Rhine Lab (arknights)|]]. After [[silence_(arknights)|Olivia Silence]] defected from Rhine Lab, she brought Ifrit with her to Rhodes Island. Due to the experiments performed on her, she is suffering from a serious case of Oripathy. Currently, she is receiving treatment at Rhodes Island, with Silence serving as her guardian. She uses a flamethrower as her weapon of choice.

As a Sarkaz, her motif is based on devils. Her callsign is named after the mythical demon from Arabic mythology.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hanamori Yumiri]].

title: u-official_(arknights)
body:
[i]U-Official, "The Ultimate Beautiful Girl", has recently completed a perilous career leap from TV host to streamer.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Eureka 

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Undisclosed[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]

      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Zalak[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]less than 1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Also known as Streamer U, an energetic yet clumsy girl who formerly work as a TV host for Bolívar's national television station.
After many disastrous events, she has decided to become a streamer, and work with Rhodes Island under [[Click_(arknights)|]]'s recommendation.

She previously appeared outside of the game as a TV hostess promoting upcoming in-universe events, which would inevitably end up in disasters.
Her fame as ""walking catastrophe":https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FbwX6feXkAAj-SY?format=jpg&name=large" got set in stone after the 2022 [[Ambience Synesthesia]] concert: After appearing as in-universe newscaster publicizing the event, 
in real life sudden covid restrictions resulted in the concert being canceled.
She then appeared as operator and protagonist of the 2023 april fools event on CN servers. Outside servers had to wait until 2024, though.

Her motif is based on [[hamster]]s. 

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Takada Yuuki]] (JP), Xiao Zheng (CN), [[LilyPichu]] (EN), and Bang Si-woo (KR).

h4. Appearance

title: blemishine_(arknights)
body:
[i]Blemishine, Kazimierz knight, is the light of glory about to bloom.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Maria Nearl

h4. Profile
[expand]

A young knight from Kazimierz and younger sister to Operator [[nearl (arknights)|Nearl]], has experience with knight sports and has demonstrated excellence in combat across a variety of tests. She now serves as a Defender Operator alongside Nearl, as per her wishes.

Also a skilled engineer and mechanic frequently seen with [[closure (arknights)|Closure]] and [[vulcan (arknights)|Vulcan]].

As with her sister and [[whislash_(arknights)|aunt]], her motif is based on the [[Pegasus]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hanazawa Kana]].

title: texas_(arknights)
body:
[i]Texas, employee of Penguin Logistics, will give the squad a tactical advantage with her Originium Arts at the start of every battle[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Cellinia Texas[/spoiler]

  [/tbody]

A quiet and laid back driver and operator from [[penguin_logistics_(arknights)|Penguin Logistics]]. She was sent to Rhodes Island along with her teammates as a liaison, where she assists with a variety of operations. Her choice of weapon is a beam sword.

Often depicted together with [[Lappland_(Arknights)|Lappland]] due to their past relationship.

Her motif is based on wolves. Her callsign is named after the now extinct [i]Texas Wolf[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[tadokoro azusa|Azusa Tadokoro]] (Japanese), Menglu Yang (Chinese), Jessica Preddy (English), Kim Chae-ha (Korean), and Ilaria Silvestri (Italian). Her art designer is [[Huanxiang Heitu]].

title: nian_(arknights)
body:
[i]Nian, a mysterious visitor from the faraway land of Yan, is willing to provide a little bit of assistance.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

A mysterious woman with profound knowledge of metallurgy. Currently staying in Rhodes Island as a visitor.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[sidelocks]], [[purple eyes]], [[pointy ears]], two [[red horns]], and a [[flame-tipped tail]]  as her main defining physical traits. Her outfit consists of a red [[bandeau]]-style [[tube top]] exposing her [[midriff]], [[white shorts]] held by a [[black belt]] with an ID attached to it, greyish-white [[boots]], and a [[white jacket]] with a distinctive red pattern on the chest side.

She is the first limited 6-star operator, debuting as one of the main characters of the side story [i]Ancient Forge[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Yuuki Aoi]] (JP), Catherine Young (CN), Li Cheng (Sichuanese), Akira Lee Watanabe (EN) and Kim Na-yul (KR). Her illistrator is [[Huanxiang Heitu]].

title: shu_(arknights)
body:
[i]Nongye Tianshi Shu of Yan, ever happy to impart all the agricultural knowledge there is.[/i]

title: chongyue_(arknights)
body:
[i]Chongyue, self-proclaimed simple warrior visiting from Yan. (But no one's ever seen him in true action)[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]. Real Name: [spoiler]Shuo[/spoiler]

The eldest of all Sui siblings. Previously a martial artist instructor at the Yanese nomadic city Yumen, he came to Rhodes Island to visit his family and stays onboard as a visitor.

One of the main characters in the side story [i]Where Vernal Winds Will Never Blow[/i].

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Seki Toshihiko]] (JP), Zhao Ling (CN-Mandarin), Jia Qiu (CN-Wuhanese), Yong Yea (EN), and Goo Ja-hyung (KR). His art designer is [[KuroBlood]].

title: splashing
body:
When a liquid (usually [[water]]) is splashed around. Often comes from one's hands or feet, from something falling into a liquid and from naturally-occurring [[waves]].

May result in a [[splatter]].

title: grim_aloe
body:
A character from [[Quiz Magic Academy]]. A member of Evol-Grims, the demonic counterparts of the QMA playable characters. She is the [[demon girl]]-version of [[Aloe (quiz magic academy)|]]. All Evol-Grims have [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Best known for being the character to popularize the term [[mesugaki]]. 

She also is one of the playable characters from [[Bombergirl]] series where her popularity came from, later also being added to [[Mahjong Fight Girl]].

title: howto:tag_checklist
body:
h4. Tagging Checklist

[expand=Table of Contents]
* [0. Basic Identification](#dtext-lv0)
** [0-i. Explicit](#dtext-lv0-1)
** [0-ii. Information and Requests](#dtext-lv0-2)
** [0-iii. Technical Information and Source](#dtext-lv0-3)
* [1. Composition and Foreground Details](#dtext-lv1)
* [2. Background Details and Artistic Errors](#dtext-lv2)
* [3. Additional Details, Canons, Memes](#dtext-lv3)
* [4. Microscopic Details](#dtext-lv4)
[/expand]

This checklist of tagging criteria has been prepared in order to give a comprehensive idea on things to look out for when tagging. The tagging criteria has been categorized by priority to bring attention to the more important tags. 

For your easy reference, common tags, along with links to relevant tag groups have been provided.

As the checklist is quite long, please take it easy when familiarizing yourself with this list. Begin with the more important tags at Level 0 (and all sub-levels), and then work your way upwards.

h6. About Tagging Priorities

Lower level tags are essential tags. Images lacking lower level tags are considered insufficient for efficient cataloging and searching.

Higher level tags are extra tags which describe the more intricate details of an image, but are more difficult to apply correctly, usually due to potential for debate, or a higher requirement of knowledge of otherwise obscure topics such as memes.

[quote]
[b]Note to taggers:[/b] Some parts of this checklist may be incomplete. Feel free to help out with expanding the checklist, however, if any part of this list grows too large, please inform the forums about creating a tag group. Remember to reference this tagging checklist!
[/quote]


h4. Ignore, Do NOT Tag

[b]Subjective tags[/b] that express opinions or subjective critique on images. Common examples are badass, cute, good, evil, moe, sexy and most other adjectives. A full list of known subjective tags may be found at [[Tag group:Subjective]].

[b]Subjective themes,[/b] such as [i]misleading thumbnails[/i] or whether something is funny or sad, are also not to be tagged.

These are better done with Pools, or even multiple tags.
For a categorized, but by no means complete, list of pools, see [[pool groups]].
The Infamous "Misleading Thumbnails" Pool is at Pool #1229.

h6. Examples

Subjective tags and themes best left as pools.

* Badass: Pool #1277
* Disgustingly Adorable: Pool #903
* Clever: Pool #330

Very generic themes best left as multiple tags.

* Blondes in Bikini {{blonde_hair bikini}}
* Bloody Fighting: {{battle blood}}
* Izayoi Sakuya in lingerie: {{izayoi_sakuya lingerie}}
* Muscular Kirisame Marisa: {{kirisame_marisa muscular}}
* Portraits of Hatsune Miku: {{portrait hatsune_miku}}, {{solo hatsune_miku}}


Note that these searches are possible from a basic Member account, with a two-tag search limit, even if a little browsing may be required.

h4#lv0. Level 0: Basic Identification

All posts MUST have these tags, if possible. These tags are responsible for making Danbooru minimally searchable, and allow [b]content filtering[/b] for viewers who do not like sexual content, or images with commonly blacklisted tags.

h6. Identification

* [b]Artist[/b] (prefix with artist: when creating a new tag)
** If the artist does not currently have a tag on Danbooru, consider creating a new one. If you don't know how to read their name to create a tag, consider asking in the forum topic "Artist tagging help":/forum_topics/8199, where someone is likely to help you come up with a name for the tag.
* [b]Copyright[/b] (prefix with copyright: when creating a new tag)
* [b]Character[/b] (prefix with character: when creating a new tag) 
** Character lists from popular copyrights are available at [[tag groups]], in the Characters section.
* [b]Source[/b]
* [[original]]
** Use this tag for illustrations that feature characters that are not related to any kind of copyright.
** Frequently, these characters appear only in the one illustration, and will not have a name. In these cases, it isn't necessary to include character tags for them; the [[original]] tag is enough.
** Sometimes, such a character may become recurring, limited to a single artist, or multiple artists on a very small scale. (In this case, they may have names. Most such named original characters can be found listed on the wiki page of the artist that created them.)

h6. Classification

* [b]Rating[/b]
** See: [[howto:rate]]
** (use the [b]Ratings[/b] choice list, or use {{rating:e}}, {{rating:q}}, {{rating:s}} or {{rating:g}}).
* [[sexually suggestive]]
** Note: [[sexually suggestive]] can carry a Sensitive rating.
* [[Spoilers]] (Important: apply if image is a potential spoiler)
[spoiler]Let's keep Danbooru a spoiler-free community.[/spoiler]

h6. Basic Image Content

* [b]Character Counters[/b]
** [[1boy]] | [[2boys|2]], [[3boys|3]], [[4boys|4]], [[5boys|5]], [[6+boys]]
** [[1girl]] | [[2girls|2]], [[3girls|3]], [[4girls|4]], [[5girls|5]], [[6+girls]]
** [[1other]] | [[2others|2]], [[3others|3]], [[4others|4]], [[5others|5]], [[6+others]]
** [[solo]] - single character, mutually exclusive with multiple copies of a character e.g. [[multiple views]] 
*** [[solo focus]] - multiple characters, focus on a single character
* [b]Framing[/b]
** [[close-up]]
** [[portrait]] - shoulders or above
*** [[head out of frame]] - shoulders or below
** [[upper body]] - above waist
*** [[lower body]] - below waist
** [[cowboy shot]] - above knees
** [[feet out of frame]] - above ankles
** [[full body]] - full body visible, close range
** [[wide shot]] - full body visible, far range
* [b]Actions/Posture[/b], see [[tag group:posture]]
** [[battle]]
** [[chasing]]
** [[fighting]]
** [[leaning]]
** [[running]]
** [[sitting]]
** [[squatting]]
** [[standing]]
** [[walking]]
* [b]Face[/b], see [[tag group:face tags]]
** Eyes, see [[tag group:eyes tags]]
* [b]Facial Expressions[/b], see [[tag group:face tags]]
** See [[tag group:eyes tags]], in the Emotions section.
** See [[tag group:face tags]], in the Emotes section.
* [b]Body Colors[/b]
** Eye Color, see [[tag group:eyes tags]]
** Hair Color, see [[tag group:hair color]]
** Skin Color, see [[tag group:skin color]]
* [b]Body Fluids[/b]
** [[blood]]
** [[saliva]]
** [[sweat]]
** [[peeing]] (Important: commonly blacklisted tag)
** [[scat]] (Important: commonly blacklisted tag)
** [[vomit]] (Important: commonly blacklisted tag)
* [b]Prominently Featured Body Parts[/b]
** [b]Body Parts,[/b] see [[tag group:body parts]]
** [b]Hair[/b]
*** [[ahoge]]
*** Hairstyle, see [[tag group:hair styles]]
** [b]Visible Skin/Level of Nudity[/b], see [[tag group:nudity]]
*** bare body parts
**** [[bare shoulders]]
**** [[bare arms]]
**** [[bare legs]]
**** [[barefoot]]
*** [[breasts]], see [[tag group:breasts tags]]
*** [[midriff]]
**** [[abs]]
**** [[navel]]
*** [[groin]]
**** [[groin tendon]]
*** [[nude]]
* [b]Wear/Costume[/b], tops and bottoms
** Attire, see [[tag group:attire]]
** Intimate/Sexual Attire, see [[tag group:sexual attire]]

h4#lv0-1. Level 0-i: Explicit

These are basic tags specific to explicit or graphic images.
[b]Important Note:[/b] If any of these tags are applied to an image, [b]consider setting the Rating to Questionable or Explicit[/b], as it will often (but not always) be appropriate, and Danbooru does not automatically do it for you. See [[howto:rate]] for precise guidelines regarding ratings.

* [b]Cum/Ejaculation[/b]
** [[cum]]
* [b]Body Parts,[/b] see [[tag group:body parts]]
** [[penis]]
** [[pussy]]
** [[anus]]
* [b]Sexual Actions,[/b] see [[tag group:sex acts]]
** [[sex]]
* [b]Sexual Positions,[/b] see [[tag group:sexual positions]]
** [[straddling]]
* [b]Sexual Themes,[/b] see [[tag group:sex acts]]
** [[bdsm]]
** [[exhibitionism]]
** [[group sex]]
** [[public indecency]]
** [[rape]] (Important: commonly blacklisted tag)
** [[incest]] (Important: commonly blacklisted tag)
* [b]Sexual Objects,[/b] see [[tag group:sex objects]]
** [[sex toy]]

* [b]Graphic Content[/b]
** [[guro]] (Important: commonly blacklisted tag)

h4#lv0-2. Level 0-ii: Information and Requests

These tags indicate if additional information about an image, such as translations or artist commentaries are available.

h6. Information Present

* [[translated]]
** To be added only when the image is considered fully translated, see [[howto:translate|Danbooru Quality: Translation Guidelines]].
* [[commentary]]
** To be added if a commentary fully understandable by an English speaker is present, or when it has been fully translated into English.

h6. Requests

* [[artist request]]
** To be added and retained until the artist has been identified.
* [[character request]]
** To be added and retained until all characters, foreground or background have been identified.
* [[commentary request]]
* [[translation request]]
** [[partially translated]]
** These tags to be added and retained until image is considered fully translated, see [[howto:translate|Danbooru Quality: Translation Guidelines]].


h4#lv0-3. Level 0-iii: Technical Image Information and Source

These tags are to used to identify specifications of an image such as pixel size (dimensions), file sizes and types of sources.

* [b]Image Sizes[/b] 
** [i]Image size tags are now applied automatically.[/i]
* [b]Illustration Source[/b]
** [[comic]]
** [[commissioner upload]]
** [[scan]]


h4#lv1. Level 1: Composition and Foreground Graphic Details

These tags are used to identify things happening in the foreground. Adding these tags brings Danbooru to an acceptable level of searchability.

* [b]Against[/b]
** [[against wall]]
** [[against tree]]
* [b]Composition and Artistic Genre[/b]
** [[landscape]]
** [[no humans]]
** [[portrait]]
*** [[solo]]
** [[still life]]
* [b]Character Archetypes, Jobs and Classes[/b] see [[tag group:jobs]]
** [[dominatrix]]
** [[miko]]
** [[ninja]]
** [[witch]]
* [b]Color of Image,[/b] see [[tag group:colors]]
** [[monochrome]]
* [b]Decorations on Image[/b]
** [[border]]
* [b]Gestures,[/b] see [[tag group:gestures]]
* [b]Generic Character Groupings and Pairings[/b]
** [[couple]]
** [[male focus]]
**** Special tag, due to the majority of Danbooru posts featuring female characters. The [[female focus]] tag is to be left unused.
** [[harem]]
** [[everyone]]
* [b]Objects in Foreground or Held or Operated by Characters[/b]
** Audio Equipment, see [[tag group:audio tags]]
** Musical Equipment, see [[tag group:audio tags]]
* [b]Legendary Creatures,[/b] see [[tag group:legendary creatures]]
** Includes supernatural humanoids or 'races' such as [[demon]], [[angel]], [[dragon]]...
* [b]Viewpoint[/b]
** [[from above]]
** [[from behind]]
** [[from below]]
** [[pov]]
* [b]Wear/Costume (Accessories)[/b]
** [[hair ornament]]


h4#lv2. Level 2: Background Graphic Details and Artistic Errors

These tags identify things happening in the background. Adding these tags greatly enhance Danbooru's searchability, possibly to the level of professional image databases such as GettyImages.

* [b]Age[/b]
** [[child]]
** [[aged down]]
** [[aged up]]
* [b]Artistic Errors[/b]
** [[artistic error]]
*** [[bad anatomy]]
*** [[bad feet]]
*** [[bad hands]]
*** [[bad perspective]]
*** [[bad proportions]]
** Note: Error tags are the only technically subjective tags approved for use on Danbooru, due to their relations with the highly subjective nature of the [[about:mod_queue|Moderation Queue]].
* [b]Background and Scenery[/b]
** [[scenery]]
** [b]Background[/b], see [[tag group:backgrounds]]
*** [[checkered background]]
*** [[colorful background]]
*** [[patterned background]]
*** [[photo background]]
*** [[simple background]]
*** [[white background]]
* [b]Location[/b], see [[tag group:locations]]
** Indoors/Outdoors
*** [[from inside]]
*** [[from outside]]
*** [[indoors]]
*** [[outdoors]]
** [[beach]]
** [[bedroom]]
** [[cafe]]
** [[city]]
*** [[town]]
*** [[village]]
** [[jungle]]
** [[mountain]]
** [[school]]
** [[shop]]
** [b]Real World Locations[/b], see [[tag group:real world locations]]
* [b]Objects in Background[/b]
** They usually carry a suffix (in picture).
* [b]Time of Day[/b]
** [[day]]
** [[night]]
** [[twilight]]
* [b]Weather[/b]
** [[blizzard]]
** [[blue sky]]
** [[cloudy sky]] / [[cloud]]
** [[fog]]
** [[rain]]
** [[snowing]] / [[snow]]
** [[sun]]

h4#lv3. Level 3: Additional Artistic Details, Canons and Memes

These tags are for those with an intimate knowledge of the images they are searching for, such as artistic techniques, celebrities and family relationships.

* [b]Celebrities/Real World People,[/b] see [[tag group:people]]
* [b]Characters, Implied[/b]
** [[animalization]]
** [[objectification]]
** [[personification]]
** Example: Cake Representing Patchouli Knowledge, Post #495479
** Example: Cockroach Representing Wriggle Nightbug (meme), Post #594819
* [b]Family Relationships,[/b] see [[tag group:family relationships]]
** Note: requires intimate knowledge of 
* [b]Medium, Traditional[/b]
** [[traditional media]]
** [[marker (medium)]]
** [[watercolor (medium)]]
** [[graphite (medium)]]
** These tags are only for art created without a computer (bar scanning or photography). They usually carry a suffix (medium) to resolve ambiguities with many tags.
* [b]Artistic Technique, Method of Creation/Preparation[/b]
** [[3D]]
** [[oekaki]]
** [[pixel art]]
* [b]Text and Languages[/b]
** [[chinese text]]
** [[korean text]]
*** hangul (use [[korean_text]])
** [[english text]]
** [[russian text]]
* [b]Timestamps[/b]
** see [[Tag group:Year tags]]

h4#lv4. Level 4: Microscopic Details

These tags identify extremely minute details in the background, often missed by a glance. The importance of tagging these details may be under debate, as they can either make or break the searchability of our images depending on the situation.

* Characters that appear far in the background
* Characters which are only partially visible
* Characters whose point of view is the subject of the image


h6. Pitfalls

Please check if tags have been [b]accidentally created[/b], usually due to a [b]spelling error[/b] or simply things like cultural differences between taggers. Such tags can be identified on the left side of a post's full view. If you see any [b]tags with a count of exactly 1,[/b] those tags may have been accidentally created.

Different taggers may have different words to describe the same actions, objects and events. Familiarizing yourself with the [[tag groups]] is particularly important to find out which tags Danbooru uses. If you have any issues, it will be best to consult the forums.

h4. See Also

* [[howto:tag|Danbooru Quality: Tagging Guidelines]]
* [[Tag groups|Tag Groups]]

title: nolan_grayson
body: Nolan Grayson is a fictional character in the Image Universe, created by writer Robert Kirkman and artist Cory Walker (with Ryan Ottley) as an expansion of a character concept created by Alan Moore and Chris Sprouse. [[Omni-Man]] is the father of [[mark grayson|Invincible]] and Oliver Grayson, and a member of the alien Viltrumite race, working as a superhero on Earth. Omni-Man appears in Supreme, Invincible, Noble Causes, and Dynamo 5.

title: omni-man
body:
[b]Omni-Man[/b], known by his civilian alias [[Nolan Grayson]], is the secondary character [spoiler]and the main antagonist[/spoiler] of the comic and cartoon series [[Invincible (series)|Invincible]].

Dubbed "the greatest superhero of Earth", Omni-Man is a humanoid alien of a race known as Vitrumites that was sent to protect the Earth from would-be invaders. He married a human named Debbie, who gave birth to his son [[Mark Grayson|Mark]]. [spoiler]In reality, he was sent by the expansionist and brutal Vitrum Empire to conquer Earth.[/spoiler]

He is voiced by J.K. Simmons.

h4. See also
* [[Broly culo (meme)|]] - also known as "Thicc Omni-Man"
* [[Think Mark think! (meme)|]]
* [[Superman]]
* [[Homelander]]
other_names: ノーラン・グレイソン

title: hibachi_(dodonpachi)
body:
The true final boss of many games in the [[DoDonPachi]] series, often found at the end of an extremely difficult second playthrough. Hibachi typically begins as a giant mechanical bee (often called Hachi); once that form is defeated, it reveals a second form: a smaller ablaze bee, and real [[danmaku|hell]] begins. 

In [[Dodonpachi Saidaioujou]], an Elemental Doll known as [[Hina (saidaioujou)|]] takes the form of Hibachi, and later Inbachi.

An earlier alternate form is seen in Daifukkatsu Black Label called Zatsuza.

A form of Hibachi or Hachi also appeared at the end (or true final boss) of the very first game, [[DonPachi]] and compared to its descendents, very underwhelming.

title: hina_(saidaioujou)
body:
Character from [[Dodonpachi Saidaioujou]]. An Elemental Doll meant to assist the human species, and sister of [[Saya (Saidaioujou)|]].

After realizing the answer to humanity's problem was to eliminate the human person, she goes berserk, later [[dual persona|referring]] to herself as [[Hibachi (Dodonpachi)|]]. She later transforms into Inbachi, an even more powerful and cold-blooded version of herself.

Voiced by [[Yuuki Aoi]].

title: saya_(saidaioujou)
body:
[[Dodonpachi Saidaioujou]] character. An Elemental Doll meant to assist the human species, and sister of [[Hina (Saidaioujou)|]].

She was introduced as a playable character in the [[Xbox 360]] port of the game.

title: columbine_high_school_massacre
body:
On April 20, 1999, a school shooting and attempted bombing occurred at Columbine High School in Columbine, Colorado, [[United States]]. The perpetrators, twelfth-grade students Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold, murdered 13 students and one teacher; ten were killed in the school library, where Harris and Klebold subsequently died by suicide. 

It is still considered one of the most infamous massacres in the United States for inspiring many other school shootings and bombings; the word Columbine has since become a byword for modern school shootings. Columbine is still both the deadliest mass shooting and school shooting in Colorado, and one of the deadliest mass shootings in the United States. 

h4. External Links
* "Columbine High School Massacre":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columbine_High_School_massacre]
* "Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Harris_and_Dylan_Klebold]

title: sessyoin_kiara_(swimsuit_mooncancer)
body:
Moon Cancer-class Swimsuit version of [[Sessyoin Kiara]] introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s event [i]Servant Summer Camp[/i]. Her outfit changes depending on her Ascension level. [spoiler]Struck by an instant death attack, Kiara respawned in place of her formerly defeated self in [i]SE.RA.PH[/i], mortally wounded at the bottom of the sea. There, she found and consumed the "clam-monster Shen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shen_(clam-monster)] and mermaids, becoming a Moon Cancer-class Servant. She then formulated a plan to try to redo her childhood and affect the antagonist's plans by returning as a young girl.[/spoiler]

An [[aged down]] [[sessyoin kiara (lily)|version]] is also seen in the story and as the event shopkeeper. She's treated as a separate character from this one.

title: ciel_(tsukihime)
body:
A character in the visual novel and anime series [[Tsukihime]], who also makes an appearance in the 2d fighting game [[Melty Blood]].

She is voiced by [[Orikasa Fumiko]] in the original Tsukihime anime, by [[Wendee Lee]] in the English dub, [[Sakuma Kumi]] in Melty Blood, and [[Hondo Kaede]] in the [[Tsukihime (remake)|2021 remake]]. Ciel also makes an appearance in [[Kagetsu Tooya]] as [[Ciel-Sensei]], where she acts as a teacher to various Tsukihime characters, among them [[Neco-Arc]].

Her birthday is May 3rd. Her height is 165, weighs 52 kg with a blood type of O. Her three sizes are B85/W56/H88. She appears to be a teenager, but her true age is much older, and unknown.

She was introduced as a MoonCancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Celeb Summer Experience!]] event.

In the original Tsukihime she has [[curtained hair]], whereas in the remake she has [[hair between eyes|bangs between her eyes]].

title: bodysuit
body:
A [[skin tight]], one-piece garment that covers the body from the neck to at least the upper legs.

Note that it has to be one piece of clothing, not separate pieces of clothing, such as a [[leotard]] over a pair of [[pantyhose]].

If it covers only the upper body and not the legs, like a one-piece swimsuit, use [[leotard]] instead. If the fabric is obviously sheer or thin, use [[bodystocking]] instead.

title: cinder_carla
body:
"Cinder" Carla is a mechanic from [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], who pilots the AC '[[full course (armored core vi)|Full Course]]'.

She is the leader of a black market arms dealer organization RaD (Reuse and Development) and an old friend of [[Handler Walter]]. [[Chatty Stick|"Chatty" Stick]] is her personal assisant AI.

As an [[Armored Core]] character, she was never depicted explicitly in canon, but some dialogues and texts seem to suggest she is at least about 60 years old, but also described as she looks too young to be one.

title: moomin
body:
[b]Moomin[/b] is a multimedia franchise created by Finnish author Tove Jansson, originally started as a series of Swedish language books and comic strips, about the adventures of a family of white hippopotamus-esque creatures in the fantasy setting of Moominvalley.

The series has a notable presence in Japan, where it has spawned numerous anime series and other pieces of Japanese media; one of the most well known pieces of Moomin media is the 1990 anime series, known in Japan as [b]Tanoshii Muumin Ikka[/b] (楽しいムーミン一家, Delightful Moomin Family) and in English simply as Moomin.

title: chuunibyou_demo_koi_ga_shitai!
body:
Chuunibyou Demo Koi ga Shitai, officially translated as [i]Love, Chunibyo and Other Delusions![/i] is a light novel series by Torako, with illustration by [[Ousaka Nozomi]]. The first volume was published in May 2011 by [[Kyoto Animation]]'s KA Esuma Bunko. The novel was one of the honorable mention recipients in the Novel category of the first [[Kyoto Animation]] Award program in 2010.

When [[Togashi Yuuta]] graduated from middle school, he was finally cured from his "[[chuunibyou]]", and determined to forget his dark history and enjoy his high school life to the fullest. But then, he met [[Takanashi Rikka]] who still has the syndrome and forced to make a contract with her...

h4. Main Characters

* [[Takanashi Rikka]]

title: raccoon
body:
An animal native to North America, notable for its black facial markings, grey fur and ringed tail, human-like hands, and penchant for mischief.

Not to be confused with the [[tanuki]], which looks similar but is a different animal that is native to Asia. A key difference is in the color of both animals' fur: raccoons have grey fur while tanuki tend to have brown fur. Tanuki also lack the "hands" raccoons are famous for.

title: laem_chabang
body:
Laem Chabang is a secondary antagonist featured in the ninth part of the [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[The JOJOLands]].
She is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user who wields [[Lyin' Eyes (jojo)|]], a [[Stand (jojo)|]] that can detect when someone is lying from their fear.

Laem Chabang is a short [[dark-skinned female]] who is [[bald]] aside from a light colored [[ponytail]]. Her face has two [[facial tattoos]] above and below her left eye of large swallows with dark and light patterns carrying a flower in their beaks. She wears round half-rim [[sunglasses]] with the rims on the bottom.

Her outfit consists of a [[collared dress]] with a column of four rectangular buttons on the top and bottom. A prominent "FURY" logo is across her chest, split between the letters on either side of her dress. Beneath it, she wears a long-sleeve shirt with crisscrossed laces running the length of her arms. The dress ends with a semicircle opening with vertical lines on both sides of it. On the side, she has a gun holster. Her legs are exposed, but she wears knee pads with spikes on the top and bottom.

title: key_west
body:
Key West is a secondary antagonist featured in the ninth part of the [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[The JOJOLands]].

Key West is a tall woman with [[long hair|long]], dark hair, [[thick eyebrows]], and an athletic build. She wears a uniform consisting of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] shirt and a [[long skirt]]. Her shirt has a large sun-shaped patch featuring a "W" logo on her chest and five beads in a V-shaped pattern on her chest pockets. She also has a circular patch on her shoulder with a "W" on it. Key wears a structured cap with the word "Key" prominently displayed on the front in a circle. Her outfit is accentuated by a leather belt with large pouches secured at her waist. Beneath her skirt she wears dark high-heeled shoes with laces, similar to a sneaker.

title: orion_(constellation)
body:
Orion is an equatorial [[constellation]], named after the mythological hunter Orion in Greek mythology. Its brightest stars are [[Betelgeuse (star)|]], part of the "Winter triangle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Triangle, and Rigel, part of the "Winter Hexagon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Hexagon.

Orion is one of the brightest and most easily recognizable constellations. Its 7 brightest stars form an hourglass "[b]⟩⟨[/b]" shape with red Betelgeuse at the top left and blue Rigel at the bottom right. At the center of the shape lies a 3-star asterism known as the "[i]Belt of Orion[/i]":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/orionsbelt.html, beneath which lies another asterism called the "[i]Sword of Orion[/i]":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/swordoforion.html (see post #8405 for reference). In addition to the hourglass shape, other stars in the constellation form patterns that depict a stick figure of Orion with one arm holding a bow (in other interpretations, a shield or hide) and the other arm raised (in other interpretations, holding a club or sword).

h4. Examples

* !asset #21778243: The hourglass shape
* !asset #21778245
* !asset #21778247
* !asset #21778246
* !post #880339
* !post #2929987

h4. Neighboring constellations

* [[Eridanus (constellation)|]]
* [[Gemini (constellation)|]]
* [[Lepus (constellation)|]]
* [[Monoceros (constellation)|]]
* [[Taurus (constellation)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Orion":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orion_(constellation)
* "Study-Style (JP): Orion":https://www.study-style.com/seiza/Ori.html
