title: howto:rate
body:
Ratings are used to categorize content on Danbooru. Danbooru has four ratings: {{rating:general}}, {{rating:sensitive}}, {{rating:questionable}}, and {{rating:explicit}}.

Broadly speaking, these categories are:

* {{rating:general}} - G-rated content. Completely safe for work. Nothing sexualized or inappropriate to view in front of others. Trivial or cartoon violence.
* {{rating:sensitive}} - Ecchi, sexy, suggestive, or mildly erotic. Skimpy or [[revealing clothes]], [[swimsuit]]s, [[underwear]], images focused on the [[breasts]] or [[ass]], and anything else potentially not safe for work. Mild violence.
* {{rating:questionable}} - Softcore erotica and/or graphic violence. Simple nudity or near-nudity, but no explicit sex or exposed genitals.
* {{rating:explicit}} - Hardcore erotica and/or extremely graphic violence. Explicit sex acts, exposed genitals, and bodily fluids.

h4. Guidelines

h6. {{Rating:General}}

* G-rated, completely safe for work content.
* Completely non-sexual scenes (fully clothed characters, innocent [[comic]]s and [[4koma]]s, [[portrait]]s, [[chibi]]s, cute things, etc).
* Content without people ([[scenery]], [[still life]]s, [[no humans]], [[text-only page]]s, [[food focus]], [[animal focus]], [[mecha]], SFW [[Pokemon (creature)|]], etc)
* Innocent displays of affection ([[hug]]ging, [[holding hands]], [[kiss]]ing that isn't sexually charged, etc)
* Trivial or cartoon violence (comedic or non-serious [[fighting]], minor [[head bump]]s, [[cuts]], [[blood]], or [[bruise]]s, or other [[injury|injuries]] that don't result in lasting harm).
* Legal drug use ([[smoking]] or drinking [[alcohol]]).
* Mild [[profanity]], insults, or rude gestures (e.g. [[middle finger]]) without lewd or sexual connotations.
* Note that anything involving child-like characters that is the least bit inappropriate or suggestive should not be rated G.

h6. {{Rating:Sensitive}}

* Ecchi, sexy, risqué, or suggestive content, even mildly so.
* Skimpy or [[revealing clothes]], including [[swimsuit]]s, [[lingerie]], [[underwear]], [[cleavage cutout]]s, [[playboy bunny]]suits, [[skin tight]] or [[impossible clothes]], etc.
* Anything focused on the [[ass]], [[breasts]], [[cleavage]], [[underboob]], [[sideboob]], [[feet]], [[armpits]], [[midriff]]/[[stomach]], [[navel]], [[lips]], or other sexualized parts of the body.
* Exposed [[groin]] area (hip lines) or [[dimples of venus]].
* [[Pantyshot]]s, [[upskirt]]s, and similar fanservice.
* Thin, [[see-through clothes|see-through]], or [[wet clothes]] that reveal the [[underwear]] or body underneath.
* Subtle [[cameltoe]]s or [[covered nipples]] not blatant enough for {{rating:questionable}}.
* Implied sexual situations (visible [[condom]]s, [[sex toy]]s in the background, [[penetration gesture]]s, etc)
* Mildly disturbing violence ([[blood]] or [[injury]] that is not G-rated).
* Depictions of thoughts of [[suicide]] or self-harm (including [[gun to head]]).
* Hard or illegal [[drugs|drug]] use.
* Anything not G-rated, not completely safe for work, or not completely safe to view in front of others.
* Anything you're not sure is safe enough for {{rating:general}}. When in doubt, use {{rating:sensitive}}.

h6. {{Rating:Questionable}}

* Simple non-genital nudity, including [[nipples]], [[areolae]], and bare [[ass]].
* Visible [[pussy|vulva]] or [[pubic hair]], if subtle and not blatantly exposed, such as in standing full-frontal nudity. "Blatantly exposed" means [[spread legs]], [[spread pussy]], [[presenting]], anything focused on the crotch, and anything where the [[pussy]] is fully visible.
* Near-nudity, such as highly [[revealing clothes]] or [[swimsuit]]s, clothing that barely hides nudity, and clothing that is partially removed or torn.
* Nipples or genitals clearly visible though clothing, including [[covered nipples]], pronounced [[cameltoe]]s, [[wedgie]]s, [[bulge]]s, and [[erection under clothes|erections under clothes]].
* Mild sexual contact ([[biting ear|ear biting]], [[groping]], [[grabbing another's breast]], heavy kissing, etc)
* Implied sex acts that aren't clearly shown.
* Simulated sex acts ([[simulated fellatio]], [[simulated footjob]], etc).
* Blatantly [[sexually suggestive]] situations ([[fellatio gesture]]s, [[oral invitation]]s, etc).
* [[Suggestive fluid]]s (unless they're obviously [[cum]] or [[pussy juice]], in which case they're {{rating:explicit}}).
* [[Bondage]], [[spanking]], [[BDSM]], and other fetish activities without visible sex acts or bodily fluids.
* [[Sex toy]]s that are plainly visible but aren't in use.
* Graphic or disturbing violence ([[death]], major blood or injury, [[ryona]], [[CBT]], serious [[abuse]]).

h6. {{Rating:Explicit}}

* Exposed genitals, including the [[pussy]], [[penis]], and [[anus]], whether [[censored]] or [[uncensored]].
* Explicit sex acts, including [[sex]], [[fellatio]], [[masturbation]], [[handjob]]s, [[fingering]], sex toy use, etc, whether [[censored]] or [[uncensored]].
* Bodily fluids, including [[cum]], [[used condom]]s, and [[pussy juice]].
* [[Guro]], [[scat]], extremely graphic violence (gore, dismemberment, etc), and NSFL content.

If you are unsure of what rating to use, post a comment or ask in topic #8495.

title: sparkler
body:
A type of handheld [[fireworks|firework]]. It's a long rod or stick held at one end while the other end burns. [[Senkou hanabi]] is a specific type of Japanese sparkler.

Don't confuse with [[sparkle]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5420701
* !post #6469623: [[Senkou hanabi]]

h4. See also

* [[holding fireworks]]

title: help:toc
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Danbooru Help Table of Contents":[#dtext-help-toc]

[/expand]

h4#help-toc. Danbooru Help Table of Contents

Welcome to the Table of Contents! This is the ultimate list of Help (help:*, about:*) and Tutorial (howto:*) Wiki pages on Danbooru, grouped by feature.

You may find the Find in Page feature of your browser handy when using the Table of Contents.

h4#lurkers. Information for Lurkers and New Users

* [[howto:get_started|New Lurkers Guide]] (read if you are new to Danbooru and similar imageboards)
* [[help:glossary|Glossary of terms]] (read to learn or as a recap to Danbooru lingo)
* [[howto:contribute|Lurker's Transformation Guide]] [b](read before posting)[/b]
* [[about:danbooru|History of Danbooru]]

h4#tos-mod. Terms of Service and Moderation

* Policy
** "Terms of Service":/static/terms_of_service (the [i]Read the rules before proceeding![/i] link)
** [[help:community rules|Community Rules]]
** [[help:upload rules|Upload Rules]]
* Moderation
** [[about:mod_queue|The Danbooru Mod Queue (Posts)]]
** [[about:upload_limits|Upload Limits]]
* Post Flags/Appeals
** [[howto:flag|Flagging Guidelines]]
** [[howto:appeal|Appealing Guidelines]]
* [[help:user_records|User Feedback]]
* Forum Threads
** Upload Feedback Thread (topic #7934)
** Deletion Appeals Thread (topic #8554)
** Flag Vandalism Thread (topic #13177)

h4#accounts. Accounts, Settings, Security & Customization

* [[help:user settings|Settings, Account Deletions and Changing Passwords]]
* [[help:saved searches|Saved searches]]
* [[help:favorites|Favorites]]
* [[help:favorite groups|Favorite groups]]
* [[help:blacklists|Blacklists]]
* [[help:dmail|Mail (Private Messages/Dmail)]]
* [[help:users|User Levels, and Upgraded Accounts]]

** Customizing Danbooru with CSS (topic #9662)

h4#posts. Posts and Ratings

* [[help:posts|Searching and Viewing Posts]]
* [[help:upload|Post Quality Guidelines]]
* [[howto:rate|Rating Guidelines]]
* [[help:post_relationships|Using Post Relationships (Child and Parent Posts)]]

** [[howto:artstation|ArtStation]]

h4#forum. Forum

h4#developers. Developer Guide

** "Docker Guide":[https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/wiki/Docker-Guide]

* "Danbooru Source Code":[https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru]
* Technical and Design Limitations

h4#tools. Tools

* [[about:userscripts|User scripts]] - Various userscripts exist to improve your experience using Danbooru and related sites.
* "Similar images search":/iqdb_queries - Search for images on Danbooru using an image link of an image file.
* "Keyboard shortcuts":/static/keyboard_shortcuts - List of available hotkeys to perform various actions.
* "Top searches":/explore/posts/searches - List of the most popular search terms by date.
** Useful to uploaders for seeing what users want to see uploaded.
* "Missed searches":/explore/posts/missed_searches - List of post search terms which produced no results over the previous week.
** Useful for determining if tag aliases or wikis need to be created.
* "Related tags":/related_tag - See the top tags related to any tag or post search.
* [b]RSS/Atom feeds[/b]
** "Posts":/posts.atom
** "Comments":/comments.atom
** "Forum topics":/forum_topics.atom

title: donkey_kong_(series)
body:
The [i]Donkey Kong[/i] series is a franchise of games created by [[Nintendo]] centering around the titular character, [[Donkey Kong]]. It's first title was responsible for the birth of Nintendo's two most iconic characters, Donkey Kong and [[Mario]], which in turn lead to the creation of the highly successful [i][[Mario (series)|Mario series]][/i]. 

The plot usually revolves around Donkey Kong and his friends, collectively known as the "Kong Family", and their adventures, usually centered in the location of Donkey Kong Island.

While the early arcade titles have Donkey Kong in a non-playable and mostly antagonistic role, since Donkey Kong Country he has also become the starring protagonist in many titles since.

h4. Games

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Title[/th]
[th]Year[/th]
[th]System[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]

title: cuttlefrsh_(splatoon)
body:
[b]Cuttlefrsh[/b] is an [[inkling_boy|inkling boy]] introduced in [i][[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]][/i] where he acts as the male player mascot for the game, alongside [[Surume_(splatoon)|Surume]], who acts as his female counterpart. 
h4. Appearance
He wears a pair of black headphones that wrap around the back of his head, black T-shirt, fingerless gloves (that are black and gray on the outside and yellow on the palms) as well as yellow mesh sneakers. His hairstyle consists of six short tentacles that have been combed backwards and are frequently seen in a green team color.

title: sessyoin_kiara_(lily)
body:
[[Aged down]] version of [[Sessyoin Kiara (Swimsuit Mooncancer)]] introduced in the Summer 2020 event of [[Fate/Grand Order]], [i]Servant Summer Camp[/i]. She was one of the main characters in the story and the event shopkeeper.

[spoiler]For her amusement and to deceive the event's antagonist, Kiara turned into her lily form and afflicted herself with amnesia. She prepared a sea shell that would transform her into [[Sessyoin Kiara (Swimsuit Mooncancer) (second ascension)|Police Kiara]] to fight enemies and save Fujimaru when necessary, turning back to her lily form before remembering the truth.[/spoiler]

title: hand_pointing_a_gun_(meme)
body:
Meme where a realistic render of a human hand pointing a pistol at the viewer is (often poorly) edited into an image of another character, to give it a comical and/or threatening aura.

The hand and pistol are cropped from a 3D render created for use in promotional materials for the 2003 video game [[true crime: streets of la|True Crime: Streets of L.A.]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Hand Pointing a Gun":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/hand-pointing-a-gun

title: four_murasame
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] mechaverse. She appears in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985. Voiced by [[Shimazu Saeko]].

[b]Four Murasame[/b] [spoilers]is a powerful Cyber-Newtype test [[pilot]] at the service of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. Her [[mecha]] of choice is the [[Psycho Gundam]]. A tormented and disturbed (but very attractive) young woman with short [[aqua hair]]. Four doesn't know her real name, as "Four" is the name given to her by scientists as she is "test subject number 4" of the Murasame Cyber-Newtype research experiments program.[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]She is mortally wounded by [[Jerid Messa]]'s [[Byalant]] during the battle at the Titans base in [[Mount Kilimanjaro]], dying in [[Kamille Bidan]]'s arms as his Newtype powers enable him to see Four's spirit leave her broken body.[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[Deux Murasame]]

title: steel_haze_ortus
body:
The second AC piloted by [[V.IV Rusty]] in [[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]].

It is a light weight bipedal AC made up entirely of the 'ALBA' series parts produced by Elcano with cooperation of Furlong Dynamics, changing its [[huge_weapon|armaments]] arsenal entirely, incorporated a [[drone|bullet orbit]] into it's armaments, keeping only the [[energy_blade|energy]] [[double blade]] from [[Steel Haze]]. Similar to Steel Haze, Ortus is also painted in predominantly admiral/azure blue and grey.
other_names: スティールヘイズ・オルトゥス

title: cataphract_(armored_core_vi)
body: AAS02: CATAPHRACT An enemy boss unit that appears in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], a heavy mobile craft used by the Planetary Closure Administration's forces. Has four [[caterpillar tracks|caterpillar track treads]] to provide mobility, while the heavy turret up top plays host to a 32-cell [[missile_pod|missile launcher]], a spread laser cannon, and two six-barrel [[gatling gun|gatling cannons]], two larger calibre four-barrel gatling cannons is fitted on each of the two front treads as hull-mounted armaments. Cataphract is piloted by a smaller [[muscle tracer (armored core)|MT]] chassis attached to the front, coincidentally being the Cataphract's only weak point.
other_names: 特務機体カタフラクト

title: raven_(armored_core_vi)
body:
[[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]] character. For the player character, see [[621 (armored core vi)|C4 621]].

The true 'Raven' whom the player borrowed the callsign from after gaining illegal entry into the planet Rubicon III, pilots the AC [[nightfall (armored core vi)|Nightfall]]. Official gender is unknown, as only the operator speaks on behalf,  but the [[Karl Urban]]-played character standing in front of Nightfall in the live action trailer seems to suggest a man.

<spoilers>Around the mid chapters of the game, Raven appears before the player and challenges them to a duel, not as reprimand for the act of identity theft, but to examine their ability to "live up to the Raven's name". Upon defeating Nightfall, the title of Raven is inherited by the player character [[621 (armored core vi)|C4 621]].</spoilers>

title: bliss_(ppg)
body:
[[Powerpuff Girls]] character unique to the 2016 reboot, appearing first in the five-part TV movie The Power of Four. Otherwise known as [i]Blisstina "Bliss" Francesca Francia Mariam Alicia Utonium[/i] (or [i]Blisstina Utonium[/i] for short), she is revealed to be the first Powerpuff Girl created by Professor Utonium in the reboot series, and would become the show's fourth concurrent Powerpuff Girl, appearing in many episodes thereafter.

Despite negative reception from fans (for her and the reboot generally), she has carved out a niche fanbase within the fandom.
other_names: ブリス(パワーパフガールズ)

title: arby's
body: An American fast food chain that serves roast beef sandwiches instead of burgers along with roast chicken, turkey and ham sandwiches. Also known for their Curly fries and milkshakes.

title: balteus_(armored_core_vi)
body: AAP07: BALTEUS An enemy boss unit that appears in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], an autonomous craft used by the Planetary Closure Administration's forces. Balteus is made up of a large mobile platform, a horizontal ring, and an [[muscle tracer (armored core)|MT]] attached to the middle serving as the control centre. The large platform provides high speed flight, hover, all-direction [[energy barrier|Pulse Armor]] projection, the horizontal ring serves as an attachment rail system for armaments such as 156 [[missile launcher|missile launchers]] and transformable flame throwers that also act as [[flaming sword|flame swords]], the MT chassis itself also carries a dual-[[gatling gun]] and a multi-barrelled scatter gun. Balteus is heavily armed, armoured and incredibly agile for its size. It is later on developed into the 'AAP07A: Arquebus Balteus'. As a boss, especially prior to its nerf, the base Balteus was notorious as the end-boss of Chapter 1 for its difficulty.

title: muscle_tracer_(armored_core)
body:
Muscle Tracer, often abbreviated as MT, is a kind of [[mecha]] that appears in most [[Armored Core]] series.

In most settings, they are worker units for heavy loads like constructions that got repurposed for combat and later developed into Armored Cores.

h4. Examples of MTs
h5. [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]] 
* [[MT-E-104]]
* Planetary Closure Administration crafts that use MT chassis as their core:
** [[balteus (armored core vi)|AAP07: Balteus]]
** [[cataphract (armored core vi)|AAS02: Cataphract]]

title: paypal
body:
PayPal Holdings, Inc. is an American multinational financial technology company.  They operate an online payment system and payment processor for online vendors, auction sites, and other businesses.  PayPal was created through the merger of the software developer Confinity and X.com, an online financial services company founded in March 1999 by Elon Musk.  It was renamed PayPal from X.com in 2001 after Peter Thiel replaced Elon as CEO.  PayPal remained the owner of the X.com brand until 2017 when they sold it back to Elon.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: PayPal":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PayPal]

title: airani_iofifteen
body:
Multiglot alien artist [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Area 15|1st generation]]. Designed by [[Yano Mitsuki (nanairo)|]]. Despite being an alien, she looks just like a (short) human being.

She has [[purple eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]]/[[pink hair|light pink]] hair with a [[gradient hair|gradient]] going from [[pink hair|pink]] to [[blue hair|light blue]]. She has [[medium breasts]], although the perspective and the baggy shirt on her default costume given the impression of her having a [[flat chest]]. Her true chest size is more evident in her later costumes and 3D model.

Her default hairstyle is a [[side up bun]] that turns into a [[side ponytail]], [[swept bangs]] and [[long sidelocks]], she wears a [[two-tone hairband|two-tone]] [[pink hairband|pink]] and [[green hairband|green]] [[bow hairband]] and a [[palette hair ornament|palette]] [[hair ornament]].

body:
An English-Speaking indie VTuber, drawn by [[chocola vt]] 

She is a small [[rabbit girl]] with [[floppy ears]], a [[rabbit tail]], [[pink eyes]], and short [[blonde hair]]. She is often portrayed as wearing [[sweet lolita]] fashion, such as her default outfit that features a pink [[suspender skirt]] with [[frilled suspenders]], a white [[sailor shirt]] with [[poet sleeves]], brown [[petticoat]], [[pink thighhighs]], white [[fur-trimmed boots]] and a [[maid headdress]]. She is also a full-time artist and occasionally will showcase her artwork on stream.

title: cannonball_(dive)
body: A type of dive in which the diver jumps as high as possible and curls into a tight ball, aiming to make the biggest possible splash on impact with the water. Often prefaced by shouting the maneuver's name in midair. Obviously of no value in competitive diving, and usually associated with boisterous clowning around rather than serious pool use.

title: cheating_(competitive)
body:
Cheating, in a competitive sense, is the act of unfairly using a device or strategy to win a competition (violating written or unwritten rules of said competition and/or those of fairness and good sportsmanship in general), regardless of how discreet it may be.

h4. See also

* [[Cheating (academic)]]
* [[Cheating (relationship)]]

title: cheating_(relationship)
body:
Cheating, in a sexual sense, is having sex with someone other than one's regular partner in a monogamous relationship. When this happens among married people, this is known as adultery. This can also apply to meeting another without the regular partner knowing.

[b]Not to be confused with:[/b]
* [[Cheating (competitive)]]
* [[Cheating (academic)]]

title: aether_portal
body:
A [[portal (object)|]] constructed from [[glowstone]] and activated with water, that allows the player to travel to [[the Aether (minecraft)|]] in modded [[Minecraft]].

Many younger players didn't understand the concept of modding and believed the Aether was in the vanilla version of Minecraft, leading to a meme about trying to make a portal in vanilla and obviously failing.

title: monk_(age_of_empires_ii)
body:
A unit in the [[Age of Empires II]] strategy game, succeeding the [[Priest (age of empires)|]] of the [[age of empires (series)|first game]]. Like its predecessor, the monk has the ability to heal friendly units and convert enemies, while also having the exclusive ability of picking up relics.

The monk is a bald man with white robes and a [[tabard]] of their team's color. They hold a large book in one hand and a [[shepherd's crook]] in the other.

title: wololo_(meme)
body: One of the chants that the [[priest (age of empires)|]] from [[Age of Empires I]] makes when using the "convert" ability on enemy's units or buildings to make them switch sides (signified in-game by a sudden change of color in the buildings or in the unit's clothes). Later became a running gag of the series.

title: priest_(age_of_empires)
body:
A unit in the [[Age of Empires I]] strategy game that can heal friendly units and convert enemy ones. He has the appearance of an elderly man with balding [[white hair]] tied in a [[low ponytail]], wearing white robes with sashes of the player's color, and wielding a [[shepherd's crook]].

This unit's infamous ability to convert enemies is the source of the [[Wololo (meme)|]] meme, named after the chant that it repeats during the conversion process.

This unit was replaced by the [[Monk (Age of Empires II)|]] in the sequel game [[Age of Empires II]].

title: chloris_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is a botanist in Windrise who sells flowers and berries. Unlike her younger sister [[Flora (genshin impact)|]] who is the owner of "Floral Whisper" and only likes flowers, she has a broader interest in plants.

Chloris has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] kept in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt ends]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[blue dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[brown bag|brown]] [[backpack]], a [[brown hat|brown]] [[beret]], [[white socks]] and a pair of [[brown shoes|brown]] [[mary janes]].

She is named after Chloris, the Greek goddess of spring and flowers. Her Roman counterpart is [[Flora (mythology)|]], whom her sister shares a name with.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Chloris":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Chloris

body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is the owner of the flower shop "Floral Whisper" in Mondstadt. Unlike her older sister [[Chloris (genshin impact)|]] who has a broader interest in plants, she is only interested in flowers. 

Flora has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] kept in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt ends]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[white dress|white]] and [[pink dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[white apron]], a [[maid headdress]], [[white socks]] and a pair of [[red shoes|red]] [[mary janes]].

She is named after [[Flora (mythology)|]], the Roman goddess of spring and flowers. Her Greek counterpart is Chloris, whom her sister shares a name with.

title: peter_cullen
body: [b]Peter Claver Cullen[/b] (born July 28, 1941) is a Canadian voice actor famously known for his role as the voice of [[Optimus Prime]] in the original 1980s [[transformers: generation 1|Transformers cartoon]] which he reprise his role in the [[transformers (live action)|live action Transformers movies]] and the 2010 [[Transformers Prime]] animated series.

title: magneto
body:
[[X-Men]] supervillain (occasionally also an anti-hero) who possesses supreme magnetic superpowers.
His birth name was [b]Max Eisenhardt[/b] (a Jewish survivor of the Auschwitz-Birkenau [[concentration camp]]) before he adopted the persona of [b]Erik Lehnsherr[/b] (a "Sinto":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinti]). He was originally the best friend of [[Charles Xavier]], but the two parted ways due to their differing stances on mutant rights; Charles opted for coexistence with humans, while Erik advocated for mutant supremacy.

title: khun_eduan_(data)
body:
Data Eduan is an artificial character, a young version of High-Ranker Khun Eduan, the Family Head of The Khun Family, back when he was still a Regular. It was created after the real [[Zahard]] stored his image in the mirror using the Mirror of the Past and asked his 12 companions, including Khun Eduan, to do the same.

Data Eduan, being the head of the Khun Family, is the one and only source of the typical traits that the family has, such as having [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes|eyes]] and having [[pale skin]]. He has [[long hair]] and his eyes sometimes vary in color while still being in a blue shade, at intervals they can have a light-blue color and at other times they can a purplish color.

title: urek_mazino_(data)
body:
Data Urek is an artificial character, a Sworn Enemy of Irregular [[Urek Mazino]] that was created by the Hidden Floor system after the real Urek finished all stages and quest very quickly to save his data. However, the system failed to copy Urek perfectly because of his power, at that time, exceeded the measurement system and caused systems' malfunctions and errors.

Data Urek appears to be much smaller than his real self. He looks like a child. When he was first seen inside the Glitch Room, he wears [[black pants]] and black [[grey jacket]] with red thunder motives with yellow strips on both of his shoulders and on the back of the jacket, starting from his neck to the middle of his back. There's also apparently MAZINO's name embroidery in the back of the jacket. He is surrounded by many [[error message]]s. He wears a white cap with red visor and silver metal [[ear piercing]]s. He has a big [[scar]]/[[facial mark]] on his right eye.

title: biscuit_(spring_puppy)_(nikke)

An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]'s [[Biscuit (nikke)|]].

She wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[striped shirt]] with [[short sleeves|short]] [[yellow sleeves]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[overall shorts]] with a [[stuffed dog]] in the pocket, a small [[red bag|red]] [[randoseru]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[white socks]] and a pair of [[yellow shoes|yellow]] [[sneakers]]. She carries a red [[chew toy]] and a bag dispenser by her right leg. Her [[hair bow]]s are now [[yellow bow|yellow]] instead of grey.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8939324: L2D

title: takizawa_seidou
body:
Seidou Takizawa (滝澤 政道, Takizawa Seidou) is a former Rank 2 Ghoul Investigator. A classmate of Akira Mado at the Academy, he was partnered with Kousuke Houji and assigned to the 20th ward to investigate the Gourmet. Though a great admirer of outstanding investigators such as Koutarou Amon and Kishou Arima, he also suffers from a major inferiority complex that brought him into conflict with his peers. At the end of the Owl Suppression Operation, he faced [[Tatara (Tokyo Ghoul)]] together with [[Amon Koutarou]] and was subsequently reported dead by the CCG.

[Spoilers]In [[Tokyo Ghoul:re]], he survived as an artificial one-eyed ghoul. As a member of Aogiri Tree, he is known as Owl (オウル, Ōru).[/spoilers]

As a human, Takizawa had short [[brown hair]] with long [[parted bangs]] and [[brown eyes]]. Like most investigators, he wore professional attire while working and had a preference for blue clothing.

After the timeskip and his reappearance as a one-eyed ghoul, his physical appearance is drastically altered. He looks more monotone and frightening. His [[white hair | hair is now white]] and visibly unkempt, its length past his chin. His [[black nails | fingernails]], toenails, and [[black lips | lips]] are now black in color. He appears more tired due to the dark circles underneath his eyebrow-less eyes, one of which is where his left kakugan manifests. Clad in all black, he dons loose-fitting [[robe | robes]] with wide, elbow-length sleeves that have a white symbol on the hood. He wears [[pants]] fitted below the knees and has wraps around his feet exposing his toes. After his restoration to sanity he wears a modification of his Aogiri Tree robes as a trench coat, black with white stripes across the midsection and on both sides of the collar. The collar is also flipped up, partially covering the backside of his head.

title: hoaqin
body:
Hoaqin (호아퀸, Hoakuin) is a Slayer candidate of FUG that was sealed in the Hell Express long ago.

Hoaqin has a very [[androgynous]] and child-like appearance with youthful effeminate features and short stature. He has a extremely [[pale skin]], with silvery-[[white hair]], [[silver eyes]], and crimson lines underneath his eyes. Atop Hoaqin's head sits a silvery-white crown and he wears the pale white gown-like garment. He carries around with him a long Zweihänder that has a spiked cross-guard.
[spoilers]After absorbing [[Vicente (Tower Of God)]] , [[David (Tower Of God)]] , and [[Anna (Tower Of God)]] , Hoaqin's overall appearance changes slightly, with his facial features becoming more adult-like and his height increasing to that of a model. His attire changes slightly too and his sword becomes more ornate with a red jewel on its guard.[\spoilers]

title: thorn_(weapon)_(tower_of_god)
body: Enryu's Thorn (엔류의 가시, Enryu-ui Gasi), also referred to as The Real Thorn, The King Slaying Thorn, The Thorn to Kill the King or simply the Thorn, is a gigantic and massive red, diamond-shaped object that was first discovered by a person with strange eyes on the 43rd Floor, the location where [[Enryu]] killed a Floor Administrator, known as the event Enryu's Massacre.

title: red_thryssa
body:
The Red Thryssa (붉은 바리, Bulg-eun Bari) is an extremely small fragment, a remnant of the corpse of the 43rd Floor Administrator that survived after Irregular [[Enryu]] killed the Administrator. It has intelligence and consciousness. 

[Spoilers]After [[Urek Mazino]] defeated Hell Joe, the soul core of Red Thryssa chose [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]] as its new host. Baam use Red Thryssa as a sword, having in moment 3 stages of transformation.[\spoilers]

title: lo_po_bia_ameuz
body:
Amizu (아므즈) was one of the companions who took part in the Great Journey with the Great Warriors.

[Spoilers]As revealed, she was [[Lo Po Bia Traumerei]]’s lover and the person Enkidu “murdered”. Her death was noted to have had a deep mental toll on Traumerei, who went through extreme lengths to try and remove his grief and longing for her.[/spoilers]

Ameuz is a beautiful woman with [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a similar traditional korean clothing, a pink [[hanbok]], but was seen wearing a [[strapless dress]] with [[purple skirt]].

title: plasma_wisp
body:
It looks like a [[will-o'-the-wisp_(mythology)|will-o'-the-wisp]] and has two eyes and two hands.
It [[floating|floats]] in the air and attacks by releasing [[electricity]] as [[needle]]s or [[energy ball]]s.

[[Kirby]] can inhale it to obtain the [[Plasma kirby|Plasma]] [[copy ability]].

title: moto_shotzo
body:
It is an enemy that appeared in [[Kirby Super Star]].
It takes the form of a small turret with two pairs of wheels.
It can be defeated or [[inhaling|inhaled]], unlike [[Shotzo]]. It has no [[copy ability]]. 

The origin of it is a tank that appears in [[TRAX]].

title: evan_edrok
body:
Evan Edrok (에반 에드록, Ehbahn Edeurok; "Evan Edrok") is a High Ranker as well the Chief Guide of Zahard Family, which is a unique position in the Tower. He always seems to follow his partner, [[Ha Yuri Zahard]].

Evan is a man with extremely short stature. He has [[silver hair]] and milky-colored skin. He switches between outfits during travel, sometimes wearing [[black overalls]] which cover his body up to his mouth while at other times a green explorer's [[jacket]]. Yuri Zahard, his partner, always makes fun of his height as being too short.

title: lovely_(kirby)
body:
A flower-like enemy that first appeared in [[Kirby Super Star]].
[[Kirby]] can't inhale it.
In [[Kirby Super Star Ultra]], [[Rosely (Kirby)|]] exists as an enhanced version of it.

In the [[Kirby: Right Back At Ya!]], she started out as an ordinary flower, but was turned into a hexenbiest by Nightmare Enterprises.
She tried to parasitize [[Whispy Woods]] to wither and die or send her calyx flying like a boomerang to take down Kirby.
Kirby can inhale her calyx to gain the [[Cutter kirby|Cutter]] [[copy ability]].

for more info, see the "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/lovely].

title: ha_jinsung
body:
Ha Jinsung (, Ha Jin-Sung) is a High Ranker of the Ha Family and worked as a martial arts teacher for FUG. He is a direct descendant of the Family Head, Ha Yurin.

Ha Jinsung is a tall, slender man with [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]], wearing a [[black shirt]] with [[brown pants]]. Jinsung used to smoking [[cigarette]], but after meeting [[Ja Wangnan]], changed cigarettes for [[lollipop]]. He is approximately half a head taller than [[Jyu Viole Grace]]. Jinsung has a perm which most people find cheap and funny.

title: urek_mazino
body:
Urek Mazino (우렉 마지노, "Urek Majino") is an Irregular, currently 4th in Rank. He was the strongest active Ranker before Zahard became active once again. He is also the most recent person to be part of the Top 5 High Rankers inside the Tower.

Urek is a tall man, noted to be handsome. He has [[blonde hair]], piercing [[red eyes]] and a well-defined musculature with a [[tattoo]] of his name and the Wing Tree symbol on his back. He generally wears a snapback backward on his head and has a 'rapper' look about him.

title: knuckle_joe
body: A recurring enemy in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. This blond spiky-haired brawler excels in [[martial arts]]. [[Kirby]] can inhale it to obtain the [[fighter kirby|Fighter]] [[copy ability]]. In the [[Kirby: Right Back At Ya!]], he is initially hostile to Kirby, but later becomes his friend. His voice actor is [[Takayama Minami]]. In [[Super Smash Bros.]] he appears from a [[Assist Trophy]].

title: bio_spark
body:
A recurring enemy in the Kirby series. It looks like a one-head-tall [[ninja]] and fights by [[throwing]] [[kunai]].

[[Kirby]] can inhale it to gain the [[Ninja Kirby|Ninja]] [[copy ability]].

title: rachel_(tower_of_god)
body:
Rachel (라헬, Lahel/Rahel; "Rachel"), also known as Michelle Light (미쉘 라이트, Misuel Raiteu; "Michelle Light") is an Irregular and was [[Twenty-Fifth Bam]]'s best and only friend as she was the only one to visit him in his "cave". 

Rachel is a girl of average height with [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes]] and a lot of [[freckles]]. In Part I Rachel wore a [[pink dress]] and a long-sleeved [[brown shirt]] under it, with a [[red ribbon]] tied around her waist and behind her back. In Part II when she was pretending to be crippled, she wore a plain white [[t-shirt]] and dark shorts but later returned to wearing her normal clothes from Part I. In her most recent appearance she wears a dark [[brown cloak]], like the rest of her group. In part III, she uses clothes more normal, like a [[shirt]], [[jacket]] and [[skirt]].

title: hatched_chick_(kirby)
body: An enemy from [i][[Kirby's Dream Land 2]][/i] and [i][[Kirby's Block Ball]][/i], also known as Crack-Tweet. It appears as a yellow hatched chick from an egg, very similar to [[Twizzy]]. Unlike Twizzy, it has three hair-like lines on its head.

title: mr._tick_tock
body:
He is a mid-boss in [[Kirby (series)|Kirby]].
He looks like a large [[alarm clock]] with a face and limbs attached, and fights by making loud noises and shooting out [[musical note]]s.
Once defeated, [[Kirby]] can inhale it to obtain the [[Mike Kirby|Mike]] [[copy ability]].

title: li_sushang_(peregrine_sword)
body: A new battlesuit for [[li_sushang|Sushang]], due to be released in version 8.2 of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]].

title: ship_leesoo
body:
Ship Leesoo (십이수, Shib Yisoo; "Shibisu") is a C-rank Regular. He is relatively weak, yet possesses a great ability to deduce and an intellect on par with [[Khun Aguero Agnis]]'s.

● Part I:
Leesoo is a normal-looking person with [[dimple]] on his cheeks and [[cropped hair]] . He is always wearing a [[purple jumpsuit]].

Part II:

Leesoo looks like he is wearing the same outfit as he did in Part I, however, with closer observation, his [[jacket]] now has a [[zipper]] on the front. In the Workshop Battle he wears a [[grey jacket]] with his hands often in his pockets, also been seen in the swimwear in Archimedes piscina. His face is also more angular and less spherical than when it appeared in Part I.

title: bomber_(kirby)
body:
Enemy from the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby]] series. It has the form of a bomb with two small legs and a skull icon on its side. If it falls of an edge, it will cause a large explosion, considerably damaging the player if hit.
If [[Kirby]] swallows it, he will obtain the [[Crash kirby|Crash]] [[copy ability]].

title: jaina_repellista_zahard
body:
Jaina Repellista Zahard (제이나 레펠리스타 자하드, Jeina Rehpehlliseuta Jahad, "Jaina Repellista Zahard") is a Zahard's Princess from the Jaina Family. She seems to be addicted to sitting in her darkened room in front of her Lighthouse watching what's happening within The Tower.

Repellista has a long [[pink hair]], a [[hair over eyes]]. She usually wears a [[yellow shirt]] and a [[blue shorts]], eating [[snack]] and [[playing games]] all day.

title: shotzo
body:
Shotzos are dark, spherical metal cannons in the [i][[Kirby (series)|]][/i] series, with hinges that many of them can readjust themselves on. They are one of the most common enemies in the series, appearing in every main series game.

h2. Common Variants
* [[Blatzy]]: A slimmer, more aggressive cannon found in extra modes.
* [[Coldtzo]]: A large blue cannon that shoots frozen balls introduced in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i].
* [[Gigatzo]]: A large cannon with a pinkish red rim and base, shooting flaming balls introduced in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i].
* Parasol Shotzo: A Shotzo which drops from above with a [[parasol]].
* [[Volttzo]]: A large black and green cannon that shoots electrical balls introduced in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i].

h2. Minor Variants
* [[Cannon Cotta]]: A [[Cotta (Kirby)|]] that has been transformed into a cannon in [i][[Kirby and the Rainbow Curse]][/i], resembling a clay pot. 
* [[Cloud Cannon]]: A Shotzo connected to a balloon with a face, from [i][[Kirby Tilt 'n' Tumble]][/i].
* [[Flame Shotzo]]: A red variant that spews fire, in [i][[Kirby: Canvas Curse]][/i].
* [[Freezo]]: A harmless, cyan snowball cannon with a [[Santa hat]] and a button eye, in [i][[Kirby's Epic Yarn]][/i].
* [[Moto Shotzo]]: A small, spherical tank on wheels in [i][[Kirby Super Star]][/i].
* [[Takotzo]]: A large octopus that shoots projectiles in [i][[Kirby Mass Attack]][/i], resembling both [[Flotzo]] and Shotzo.
* [[Wall Shotzo]]: A Shotzo indented into the wall, in [i][[Kirby 64]][/i].

title: mumbies_(kirby)
body:
A small, floating enemy wrapped in bandages with one visible glowing eye that has appeared in many games throughout the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby]] franchise.

For more info, see the "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/Mumbies].

title: gordo
body:
Gordos are recurring enemies throughout the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby series]], generally appearing as a spiked ball with eyes. They generally serve as stage hazards, as they usually cannot be inhaled or defeated with attacks.

For more info, see their "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/Gordo].
other_names: ゴルドー(星のカービィ)

title: blipper
body:
They are a type of minor enemy that appears in [[Kirby (series)|]].
They have the appearance of round fish and wear [[diving mask]].
They usually swim underwater, but will sometimes jump on [[Kirby]] when he is on the water.
They have no [[copy ability|copy abilities]].

title: karaka
body:
Karaka (카라카, Kahrahka) is a High Ranker and also a new, young Slayer of FUG.

Little is known about Karaka's true appearance, as he has only been seen hidden in shadows or in an [[armor]]. Through his mask he appears to have [[yellow eyes]]. Karaka also owns the same [[Zahard]]'s Ring like [[Ja Wangnan]]'s ring.

title: ja_wangnan
body:
Ja Wangnan (자 왕난, Ja Wangnan) is one of the main protagonists of [[Tower of God]]: Part 2 - The Return of the Prince. He aspires to be the king of the whole Tower. He values his determination in life more than anyone else's desires. He plans to scale up the Tower's Floors and reach the true top of the Tower, unlike those who have given up.

Wangnan has [[yellow eyes]], [[blonde hair]] with a [[mole under eye]]. He usually wears [[jumpsuit]] like clothing, with a slightly more intricate [[coat]], but wears a formal [[suit]] underneath. He has red [[horns]] behind his ears, 2 [[fangs]] in his mouth and wears a [[ring]] bearing the emblem of [[Zahard]] (the same as [[Karaka]]'s).

He has been seen with different costumes during the story like [[suit]] with [[jacket]] and summer clothes.

title: chocolate_egg
body: An Easter treat in the shape of an egg (usually much smaller) made of chocolate, wrapped in festively decorated aluminum foil.

title: benny_(kirby)
body:
Bennys are vaguely humanoid enemies from the [[kirby's_dream_land|Kirby's Dream Land]] that appear only in the increased difficulty "Extra Game" mode.

For more info, see their "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/Benny]

title: ha_yuri_zahard
body:
Ha Yuri Zahard (하 유리 자하드, Ha Yoori Jahhahd; or "Ha Yuri Jahad"), more commonly known as Yuri Zahard (lacking her family name), is a High Ranker and Princess from the Ha Family. She is also the owner of [[Black March (weapon)]] and [[Green April (weapon)]] , two of the 13 Month Series Ignition Weapons. She is the first Princess to own two 13 Months at the same time since [[Garam Zahard]], and the only other Princess known to have achieved such.

Yuri is renowned as a beautiful fair-skinned Princess with a  very long [[black hair]] that is always seen tied into a [[ponytail]] by a [[red ribbon]] or fascinator on the left side of her head with bangs swept to the right side, piercing [[red eyes]], a very lithe figure and an above average sized bosom. 

She wears two different outfits:

● In Part I, she wore a [[white jacket]], [[black shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[red skirt]] and [[black pantyhose]]. She had the crest of [[Zahard]] on her tie.

● In Part II, she was seen wearing a [[pink shirt]], with a long maroon [[skirt]] and matching [[blouse]]. She wore an overcoat with red and black fluff in royal appearances. She was seen without her tie at this time. In her most recent appearance Yuri wears a smart dark [[grey jacket]], over a black [[t-shirt]], and [[black pants]].

title: grizzo
body:
An enemy that looks like a bear wearing a headband that has appeared in many games throughout the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby]] franchise.

For more info, see the "wiki page":[https://wikirby.com/wiki/grizzo].

title: yeon_yihwa
body:
Yeon Yihwa (연 이화, Yeon Yihwa; or "Yun Eehwa") is a D-rank Regular who is also a direct female descendant of the Yeon Family. She has been climbing the Tower with [[Jyu Viole Grace]] and Team Tangsooyook after the very beginning of part 2.

Yihwa is a tall girl in her early twenties, with straight [[black hair]] often held in place by her [[hairband]] which has the symbol of the Yeon Family on it, a [[flower]]. In part 2, Yihwa usually uses a [[black dress]], changing after Workshop Arc for a [[school uniform]] with [[black sailor collar]].

title: otonari-san_(sasaki_to_p-chan)
body: Kurosu is a female character from the series [[Sasaki to P-chan]] (Eng: Sasaki and Peeps).  She is a middle schooler with [[black hair]] drawn into a [[ponytail]], [[brown eyes]], and is commonly seen in her [[school uniform]].  She is regularly referred to in the series simply as [i]Neighbor (Otonari-san)[/i], and lives in the apartment next door to the protagonist [[Sasaki_(sasaki_to_p-chan)|]].  Due to her neglectful mother, she regularly meets Sasaki while sitting outside the door to her apartment.

This also apply to its alternative forms like the "﬩" with its lower leg omitted, sometimes used to avoid resemblance to the Christian cross.

For standalone "+" symbol without those usage contexts, use [[Greek cross]] instead.

title: goat_girl
body:
A female human, monster or [[furry|anthropomorphic]] creature that features goat-like characteristics.

[[Sheep girl]]s are often mistaken for goats - while goat horns can curve, they usually do not curl around like sheep horns do. Additionally, sheep tails usually point down, and goats do not have a divided upper lip like sheep.

h5. Goat physical characteristics
* [[goat ears]]

title: takanashi_kiara_(dirndl)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Takanashi Kiara]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/takanashikiara/status/1535704503999242240].

It's a traditional [[dirndl]] consisting of a [[white choker|white]] [[frilled choker]], a [[green dress|green]] [[pinafore dress]] with [[square neckline]] and a [[bodice]] worn over a [[white shirt]], with [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[short sleeves]], an [[aqua apron|aqua]]/[[blue apron|blue]] [[waist apron]] with a [[heart print]] held with a matching [[striped sash]] tied into a [[waist bow]], aqua [[ankle strap]]s and [[sandals]].  She also has [[flower bracelet]]s and an optional [[pink jacket|pink]] [[open jacket|open]] [[blazer]]. A bit oddly, the knot in her sash is on the right side, which customarily indicates that the wearer is married.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she now has a [[crown braid]] decorated with a [[flower wreath|flower]] [[head wreath|wreath]] and small [[hair flower]]s, [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[blunt bangs]] forming a [[center-flap bangs|center flap]] and a pair of [[hair flaps]] and short [[sidelocks]], she also has a pair of [[bird on head|birds on her head]]. On July 2022 she got an additional hairstyle for this attire with part of her braid undone into a [[side ponytail]] going [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]] and [[swept bangs]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #6231677: Profile

title: pittsburgh_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy heavy cruiser USS [i]Pittsburgh[/i] (CA-72). 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is overall similar to [[Baltimore (azur lane)|her sister Baltimore]], which consists of a dark [[blue coat]] worn [[coat on shoulders|on her shoulders]] and [[clothes writing|with her name on it]], a [[black leotard|two-]][[white leotard|tone]] [[leotard]] with a [[navel cutout]], [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces held together to her back, containing all three of her 203 mm triple gun mounts, two 127 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], and aircraft cranes.

title: plymouth_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Plymouth[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration.
Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]], voiced by [[Murakami Manatsu]].

She represents the original plans for [i][[Edinburgh (Azur Lane)|]][/i] and [i][[Belfast (Azur Lane)|]][/i], armed with four quad 152mm guns and an expanded hull. Ultimately, development of the quad mount never finished due to gunnery and weight issues. Like other British/Royal Navy Light Cruisers, she is only equipped with Short Fuse AP Shells.

Her physical attributes are [[long hair|long]] light [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[white shoes|white]] [[pumps]] with wings, and a [[red ribbon]] on her right arm.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a large floral white ring to her back, [[black wings]], a secondary set of [[white wings]], her four 152 mm quad mounts arranged two each per side, and two 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] arranged one per side.

title: dark_fountain_(deltarune)
body:
A major plot element in [[Deltarune]]. They are pillars of [[darkness]] (sometimes appearing to be blue, and manifesting in the Light World as [[black smoke]]) that give the Dark Worlds form and fuel their existence.

[spoiler]According to [[Ralsei]], [[Titan (deltarune)|]]s are born when too many Fountains exist, or (as shown in Chapter 4) when one is created inside of another Dark World.[/spoiler]

title: palutena_bow_(kid_icarus)
body:
A weapon of the Bow category from the [[Kid Icarus]] series. It is a blue [[bow (weapon)|]] with golden edges that was crafted by [[Palutena]], and is the weapon most associated with [[Pit (Kid Icarus)|]], as seen across the [[Super Smash Bros.]] Series and in the box art of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]].

This weapon, much like the other bows in Kid Icarus Uprising, can have its two halves separated into [[dual wielding|dual]] blades during close combat.

title: bismarck_(sei_juushi_bismarck)
body:
The titular [[mecha]] from the [[Sei Juushi Bismarck]] science fiction series from the 80s.

In the Saber Rider and the Star Sheriffs adaptation, the Mecha is called [b]Ramrod[/b]. Unlike the Bismarck anime, Ramrod is voiced when transforming into its robot form by [[Peter Cullen]] with a John Wayne-like voice where it voices its famous transformation speech.

"[i]Acknowledged April. Navigational Control On. Ramrod Challenge Phase One. Head 'em up, move 'em out...power stride, and ready to ride[/i]."

title: iris_(arknights)
body:
[i]Master of the Castle Iris, giving her utmost to grant all children sweet dreams.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]April 2[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]147 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Master of the Castle of Dreams and Keeper of the Cradle. A Victorian Operator who came to Rhodes Island to return a certain Operator's safekept items. [spoiler](Bluishsilver, who was killed in action during the Chernobog operation in [i]Chapter 8: Roaring Flare[/i])[/spoiler] Temporarily residing at Rhodes Island until all related matters are dealt with. Uses peculiar sleep-inducing Originium Arts and is able to control the contents of their dreams.

Her Chinese name "爱丽丝" can be read as [i]Alice[/i], which in conjunction with her motif and abilities, is a reference to [i]Alice's Adventures in Wonderland[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice Actor)|]].

h4. Skins

* [[iris (mirror visitor) (arknights)|Mirror Visitor]]

title: moved_by_freedom
body:
A BL novel in the xianxia genre by A1TA.

For 25 years, the dangerous demon [[Feng Huangyu]] has been imprisoned on the mountain, who in the past was able to move mountains and lands. In an instant, the demon awakens, but instead of revenge, he prefers to figure out the reasons for his awakening, meeting old acquaintances.

h4. Main characters

title: bb_(swimsuit_mooncancer)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[bb (swimsuit mooncancer) (fate)|BB Swimsuit MoonCancer]] in her Third Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Her hairstyle returns to normal, but the hair length grows significantly longer. She wears a black vampire-styled coat with a large popped collar, a [[white leotard]], a red bowtie, [[white gloves]], and red [[high heels]]. She is also accompanied by a series of demonic black, red and yellow tentacles [spoiler]due to the connection she made with Nyarlathotep[/spoiler]. She always wears this Ascension's swimsuit during her Noble Phantasm, Cursed Cutting Crater. While she is more playful in her first two Ascensions, she is evil in this one.

In the absence of outerwear, this costume can be distinguished from her [[BB (fate/extra)|default attire]] by the length of her neck ribbon and the halterneck design of her collar, as opposed to her non-summer version having a sleeved shirt.

This tag can include her tanned and non-tanned variants.

title: kyo_kaneko
body:
A former [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], from the sixth wave [[ILUNA (Nijisanji)|]]. Designed by [[Shinotarou (Nagunaguex)|]]. He graduated on February 16th, 2024.

Kyo has [[blue hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[pink hair|pink]] and [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], and [[yellow eyes]]. His default outfit is the Iluna [[school uniform]] ([[white jacket]], untucked [[white shirt|white]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], [[green necktie|green]] and [[blue necktie|blue]] [[necktie]], [[black belt]], [[grey pants|grey]] [[plaid pants]]) but he also wears a [[multicolored clothes|tri-color]] [[hoodie]] set in [[yellow hoodie|yellow]]-[[white hoodie|white]]-[[blue jacket|blue]], a [[wristwatch]], [[white shoes|white]] and [[blue shoes|blue]] [[sneakers]], and [[bracelet]]s on his left arm.

title: morita_assault_rifle
body:
A fictional [[assault rifle]] from the 1997 movie adaptation of [[Starship Troopers]]. It is the standard-issue rifle of the [[Mobile Infantry]].

The Morita is a [[bullpup]] assault rifle with a large carrying handle (similar to the [[FAMAS]]) and is equipped with integrated an [[underbarrel shotgun]], although a carbine version without the shotgun also exists.

h4. External links:
* "Starship Troopers Wiki":[https://starshiptroopers.fandom.com/wiki/Morita_Assault_Rifle]

title: mobile_infantry
body:
A fictional [[military]] group from the [[Starship Troopers]] classic [[science fiction]] novel from the 1950s. It also appears in the [[Uchuu no Senshi]] anime adaptation from the 1980s.

The [b]mobile infantry[/b] is a futuristic human military unit of [[space marine]]s equipped with [[power armor]]s and involved in an interstellar war between mankind and an [[arachnid]] [[alien]] species known as "the Bugs".

In Paul Verhoeven's 1997 movie adaptation, instead they're depicted as regular [[soldier|soldiers]] with futuristic [[body armor]] instead of power armor.

h4.Notable members

* [[Johnny Rico]]
* [[Dizzy Flores]]

h4.See also

* [[Marauder (starship_troopers)|]] The power armor the Mobile Infantry use 
* [[Morita assault rifle]] Service weapon of the MI (in the 1997 movie)
* [[Mobile suit]]
